loans.name: Gautaala

texts.en: Gautaala is a 53 year old widow with 6 children. She is still operating her elei design business, selling  lavalava around her village and at town. Gautala applied for another loan to purchase more materials and tools for her elei business, wants to renovate her home and also needs the money to assist in paying her kids shool fees. Therefore, the following will be utilised with the money she is applying for;to buy painting tools and designs, fabric, fabric paints, timber, cement, school fees. She hopes to save more of her profits for immediate family needs and also things needed for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy painting tools and designs, fabric, fabric paints, timber, cement, school fees

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
El  Joven German Antonio  trabaja en un restaurante de  la ciudad de león, desempeñando el cargo de mesero, labora de lunes a martes y de jueves a domingo iniciando  sus labores a las 10 am y concluyendo  a la 10 pm  anteriormente laboraba como  docente Es padre de tres hijos todo de edad escolar y realiza este trabajo para la mantención de su hogar.  

Se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un  crédito para solventar la necesidad de gastos de colegiatura y útiles escolares de sus tres hijos. 

Los sueños del  Joven es lograr la preparación de sus lindos hijos.
texts.en:
Young German Antonio works in a restaurant in the city of León as a waiter. He works Monday to Tuesday and Thursday to Sunday from 10am until 10pm. He previously worked as a teacher. He is the father of three children, all of whom are of school age, and he works in the restaurant to support his family.

He approached CEPRODEL to request a loan in order to cover the schooling expenses for his three children and buy school supplies.

German Antonio’s dream is to give his lovely children training for their future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses

loans.name: Santa Magdalena Group

texts.en:
The hard-working men and women who live in Santa Lucia La Reforma in the Department of Totonicapan, Guatemala work fields of corn, wheat, beans, potatoes, sweet potatoes and tomatoes. Avocados and cassava are also grown here. The most famous fruit of the area are the vibrant green limes which are sizeable, tasty and smell delicious!

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Santa Magdalena” was formed here and consists of eight women. Maria is one of the members. She is 32 years of age and has four children who range in age from nearly two years to eleven years. They are the joy of her life and she works hard to support them. Maria sells food three times per week in a space just outside of her house. In this way, she can also care for her small children. Maria plans to continue with her current business but wants to increase her menu by selling French fries. She is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge which she will use to purchase a cart for producing the fries and buy a cylinder of propane gas in order to cook them.

Each Trust Bank of Friendship Bridge meets on a monthly basis. The ladies make payments on their loans and also receive valuable educational trainings on subjects like personal hygiene and nutrition, self-esteem and women’s identity, effective business practices and money management as well as budgeting. For many of the women, this is the first time they are receiving information on these subjects.

Maria, along with the seven other ladies of the “Santa Magdalena” Trust Bank send greetings and blessings to KIVA investors. They feel very grateful to have the opportunity to secure a loan and useful education in order to create more successful lives for themselves, their families and their community of Santa Lucia La Reforma.

loans.use: To purchase a cart for producing fries and buy a cylinder of propane gas.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: el señor Augusto Cesar es padre de una niña que cursa su primaria por la que se esfuerza por sacarla adelante dia a dia en sus estudios, trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde segun los pedidos que tenga de su demanda, su negocio lo empezo con una maquina y una computadora hoy en día el señor cuenta con tres maquinas para hacer trabajos y dos computadoras , es un cliente luchador, solicita el financiamiento para compra de papeleria para tener inventario en existencia y poder atender su demanda a lo inmediato.
texts.en: Augusto Cesar is the father of a little girl in primary school, for whom he puts in effort day after day so she can continue with her studies. He works Monday to Saturday from 7am to 7pm, depending on the  number of orders he has to fill. He started his business with a machine and a computer, and he now has three machines for jobs and two computers. He is a determined client. He is requesting financing in order to purchase stationery so he can have a well-stocked inventory and be able to meet demand immediately.

loans.use: to buy printing materials, bond paper, printer ribbons, toner, and paper for cards

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Abel es un hombre  emprendedor quien desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de variedad y delicioso pan dulce. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mismo con el fin de mejorar sus ventas. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un carretón para la comercialización del pan dulce de tal forma que le permita llegar a nuevos clientes y así cubrir una mayor cuota de mercado. Confía que con el apoyo de FUSAI logrará su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Abel is 33 and lives with his family in his own house. Abel is an enterprising man who has been selling varieties of delicious sweet bread for 4 years. He sells the bread by distributing it around the main areas of his neighbourhood, and this is how he makes a living. This business is his principal source of income, which is why he has taken the decision to invest in it in order to improve sales.

He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in buying a small cart to sell his sweet bread, so that he will be able to reach new customers and thus achieve a bigger market share. He hopes that with FUSAI's support he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy a small cart to sell bread.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es: Don Justiniano se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, su esposa a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos, gallinas los cuales vende para aportar con los gastos del hogar, sus tres hijos continúan estudiando y apoyando a sus padres con los quehaceres de la finca. Justiniano solicita el crédito para reparar cerca para el área de siembra y asegurarla para que los semovientes no entren a dañar los cultivos.
texts.en: Justiniano works in agriculture and raising livestock. His wife raises small animals like pigs and chickens which she sells to contribute to the household expenses. They have 3 children who are minors and study at Primary school in the mornings and in the afternoon help their parents with the farm chores. Justiniano is requesting a loan to repair the fence around the area they seed to ensure that the livestock don't damage the crops.

loans.use: to buy material like barbed wire, posts, staples and pay for labor.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena de 67  años de edad,  es madre soltera, no tiene hijos  que dependan de ella, vive en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Magdalena tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 21 Años  a la venta de tortillas en el mercado de san Lorenzo, ella vende de lunes a domingo,  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante pese a su edad ella está luchando por mejorar su condición de vida.
Doña Magdalena está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, cal, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, su sueño es mejorar su casa y ayudar a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 67 years old and is a single mother. She doesn't have any children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. Magdalena owns the house she lives in. For the last 31 years, she has made a living by selling tortillas in the market in San Lorenzo. She sells from Monday to Sunday; she is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead. In spite of her age she is striving to improve her living conditions.

Magdalena is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. With the support of this loan she aims to improve her earnings and her quality of life. Her dream is to improve her house and help her children.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sang has a retail business, selling dry food. She is 50 years old and she is married, with three children. Sang lives with no dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is her first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Sang has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Sang hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Adilia Azucena

texts.es: Doña Adilia es originaria de La Concepción, departamento de Masaya, viuda y madre de cinco hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que logro abastecer su pulpería con más productos y  así mejorar sus ventas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Verduras, Queso, Leche, Crema entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Adilia is from La Concepcion, Masaya. She is a widow and has five grown children. She is a businesswoman. She works tending a small grocery store. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since she was able to stock her store with more products and improve her sales. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, cheese, milk, and cream, among other things. She thinks that the loan will be very helpful for her, since she will be able to increase her sales and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, cheese, milk, and cream, among other things.

loans.name: Deysi Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Deysi al igual que los diferentes habitantes de la zona también se dedica al cultivo de zanahoria ya que la zona es apta para dicha hortaliza la cual se cosecha con mucho éxito. Ella tiene una edad de 45 años, madre soltera de 3 hijos el mayor quien es ingeniero agrónomo es quien le apoya y la instruye en sus cultivos de hortalizas siendo el quien le ayude tanto económicamente como en el campo, el segundo estudia en la escuela en primer grado y el ultimo quien no tiene edad aun para asistir al kinder. Por más de 16 años se ha dedicado a dicha actividad con la cual ha podido salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo que ellos necesiten como alimentación, vestimenta, medicina aunque con muchas restricciones, entre otras. Como segundo medio de ingreso para su familia también trabaja la alfarería siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar desde muy temprana edad. Su mercado para la venta de su producto está ubicado a 20 kilómetros de la zona donde ella habita  al cual viaja en el auto bus de la ruta. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa de habitación permitiendo esto dar asistencia permanente a sus cultivos. 
Doña Deysi solicita apoyo financiero para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de zanahoria mediante la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, etc. los cuales son necesario para asistirlos y al final de la temporada obtener una cosecha que rinda frutos positivos de su trabajo. Sus metas seguir ampliando sus cultivos, poder con el tiempo diversificarlos y sembrar otra clase de hortaliza, apoyar a sus 2 hijos menores en sus estudios y dar la oportunidad al mismo al igual que el mayor para que puedan estudiar y graduarse a nivel superior.
texts.en:
Deysi, like many of the people who live in the area, grows carrots since the area is good for growing this crop, which produces successful harvests. She is 45 years old and the single mother of 3 children. The oldest one is an agricultural engineer. He is the one who supports her and instructs her in cultivating vegetables. He also helps her economically as well as in the field. The second child is in first grade and the last one isn’t old enough to go to kindergarten yet.

For the past 16 years she has worked in this business. With it she has been able to provide for and support her children in everything that they needed, such as food, clothing, and medicine, though with many restrictions. As a second mode of income for her family, she also makes ceramics. Her parents taught her to work from the time she was very young. The market where she sells her product is located 20 kilometers from the area where she lives. She travels there on the bus that runs that route. Her crops are located on the same property where her house is, which allows her to give constant maintenance to her crops.

Deysi is requesting a loan to be able to care for and maintain her crop of carrots, which require care in order to have a good harvest at the end of the season that will show the positive fruits of her labor. Her goals are to continue expanding her crops, and, over time, to be able to diversify them and plant another type of vegetable, and also to support her 2 younger children in their studies and give them the same opportunity that the older one had so that they will be able to study and graduate from college.

loans.use: para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, etc. para asistir sus cultivos de zanahoria

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MOUGNOU ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des boissons, des grains et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe MOUGNOU sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. LIDY 1ère  femme debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 2 casiers de COCA-COLA ,2 casiers de FANTA et 2 casiers de Bière.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Mougnou Group average 34 years of age and 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The women know each other through family ties and make a living trading condiments, beverages, grains and other products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Mougnou Group are on their 2nd solidarity loan cycle. Lidy, who is standing on the far right of the photo, intends to use the loan to buy two crates of Coca-Cola, 2 crates of Fanta and 2 crates of beer. She buys her products locally. She sells her products to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash and often on credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 FCFA that she will use to cover expenses related to healthcare, food and education costs. She will reinvest the remaining profit into her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El ciente de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia se dedica desde hace 7 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y sorgo, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable que siempre esta en busca de darle lo mejor a su familia, por esa razón esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Jamilton is 27 years old and lives in his own home with his family.  He has been engaged in farming for seven years; his main crops are corn and sorghum.  He is a responsible, hardworking man that is always looking to provide his family with the best, and for this reason, he is requesting a loan with Integral.  He will purchase manure, fertilizers, pest control substances, herbicides, seeds, etc. to improve the land that is shown in the photograph.  In this way, he will be able to continue with his sowing, his only source of work, and have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, pest control substances, herbicides, seeds, etc

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan de Dios mayor de edad padre soltero de tres hijos todos mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productiva y comercial donde predominan el turismo por sus hermosas playas, venta de pescados entre otros, Juan de Dios es un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, Juan es propietario de una fritanga donde ofrece deliciosas comidas como: pollo y carne asada, gallo pinto, tortitas de carne, enchiladas, tacos, repochetas, tajadas maduros con queso frito entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de esta localidad al igual que sus ventas son al contado a clientes fijos y eventuales, gracias al buen servicio que Juan les ofrece a sus clientes es que hoy en día tiene mayor demanda de sus productos, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de productos de consumo como: carnes, pollo, maduro, queso, tortillas, tomates, chiltomas, carbón, platos descartables bolsas plásticas entre otros. Juan de Dios agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is an older man and the single father of three adult children.  He's from a town in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  The area is a productive and commercial area known for tourism because of the beautiful beaches, for fish sales, and for other activities.

Juan de Dios is a hardworking and responsible man who has a great desire for personal self-improvement.  He owns a fried-food business and sells delicious dishes such as grilled chicken and beef, "gallo pinto" [rice and black beans], meat sandwiches, enchiladas, tacos, "repochetas" [quesadilla-tacos], sliced plantains with fried cheese, and other things.

Juan makes his purchases in cash in the town markets and also makes cash sales to steady and occasional customers.  Thanks to Juan's good customer service, his products are in high demand these days.

The goal of this loan is to buy food products such as meat, chicken, plantains, cheese, tortillas, tomatoes, chiltoma peppers, charcoal, disposable plates, plastic bags, and other supplies.

Juan de Dios is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders give to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy food, charcoal, plates, bags, and other things

loans.name: Josue Abinadab

texts.es:
Josué, se siente satisfecho de los buenos resultados que tuvo con el crédito anterior puesto que su productividad aumento, sus ventas son mejores, los ingresos son mayores y con ellos ha cancelado sus deudas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
Josué opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y semilla, para preparar la siembra y protegerla de plagas.
texts.en: Josué feels satisfied with the results of his last loan as he increased his productivity, his sales and his profits. He paid off his debts and has improved the family's lifestyle. Josué has decided to get another loan to invest in the purchase of manure, insecticides, seeds and fertilizer to prepare for seeding and to protect his crops from infestations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Chiền

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiền operates a food stall or restaurant where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. 

Chiền is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2014, Chiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  

The main hardship that Chiền faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares her neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Chiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Suyapa  de 40  años de edad,  es soltera, tiene tres hijos  que dependen de ella, ambos van a la escuela,  vive en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Suyapa tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 08 Años  a la venta de tortillas en el mercado de San Lorenzo, vende de lunes a domingo y es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Suyapa está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y cal, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Suyapa is 40-years old, single and has three dependent children who go to school.  She lives in a San Lorenzo community, a valley in the south of Honduras.
Doña Dilma has her own home.  For the last eight years, she has made her living selling tortillas in the San Lorenzo market.  She sells from Monday to Sunday.  She is a hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead.  
Doña Dilma is requesting the loan to purchase corn, firewood and limes.  With the help of this loan, she plans to improve her income and her quality of life.  Her dream is to make improvements to her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and limes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and seasonings

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Greetings from a rural area of Waterloo in Freetown! This is Abibatu. She is 23 years old; a local, married woman. Abibatu has two children. One of Abibatu's children is still going to school. Abibatu sells over-the-counter medicines in a busy market place. She has been in this business for the past 5 years to help her children have a better standard of living. She works from 8am to 5pm each day. 

Abibatu is a well-regarded member of BRAC Sierra Leone, having already taken out and paid back four loans which she used to develop her business. 
She wants to use this loan to buy more medicines to sell in the market. In the future, she would like to have her own drug store to sell more products and reach more customers. She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell in the market.

loans.name: Santos Ermel

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de agricultura, hace 25 años que cultiva granos básicos y café el cual vende en granos en los mercados locales. el cultivo lo realiza en una zona montañosa. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo siendo el cuarto ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar fertilizantes para darle asistencia técnica a la finca de café con el fin de obtener mejor cosecha y mejores ganancias. Su meta es crecer con su negocio para poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Gracias, Lempira.

His entire life has been devoted to agricultural work. For the past 25 years, Santos has been growing basic grains and coffee and then sells his output to local markets. His crops are grown in a mountainous area. Santos decided to request another loan, which will be his fourth one, in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee farm, obtain a better harvest, and generate more income. His goal is to grow his business so that he can help his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1974. He is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Mohammad's business is the only source of income for him and his wife. He has been running his clothes store for 5 years. Now he is planning to purchase a new merchandise of summer clothes in order to raise his profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of summer clothes for his business.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKAN ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies SANTORO II l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKAN sont à leur  16ème  prêt solidaire. MAIMOUNA 2ème femme  à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 pièces de Wax, 15 robes, 20 jupes et 20 pantalons. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkan Group average 40 years of age and 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Santoro II, a neighbourhood in the city of San/Segou (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The women know each other through family ties and make a living trading clothing and various products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Benkan Group are on their 16th solidarity loan cycle. Maimouna is the woman second from the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 lengths of traditional waxed cloth, 15 dresses, 20 skirts and 20 pairs of trousers. She buys her products locally from wholesalers. She sells her clothes to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash and often on credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 FCFA that she will use to cover healthcare, food and clothing expenses. She will reinvest the remaining amount into her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu operates a fishing business. She is 29 years old and she is married with one child. Thu lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in her business for 7 years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her life is not having a latrine. Her family shares the neighbour's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: 3.7.1004.2.thiệu Long Group

texts.en:
Hồng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Hồng is 36 years old and she is married with two children.  Hồng is the group leader of the 3.7.1004.2.Thiệu long solidarity group, which consists of three members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoá district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women.  Hồng has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is a 24 year old single single mother of 2 children. She is starting up a small canteen business selling fried chicken with rice or banana and has been doing this for some months now. Queen has requested a loan to buy more chicken leg quarters, bananas and rice, spices, cooking oil, soya. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Queen will use her profit to improve her business and also her family living.

loans.use: buy more chicken leg quarters, rice,spices, cooking oil, bananas, soya, paper plates

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  44 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DALLAN l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. BAOUMOU 1ère femme debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10Kg de riz, 5Kg de fonio, 2Kg d’ognon, 1Kg de sel, 5 Litres d’huile et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi Group average 44 years of age and 7 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Dallan, a neighbourhood in the city of San in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The women know each other through family ties and make a living trading general food products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Benkadi Group are on their 7th solidarity loan cycle. Baoumou is the woman standing on the far right of the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 10kg of rice, 5kg of fonio, 2kg of onions, 1 kg of salt, 5 litres of oil and 1 packet of Maggi bouillon cubes. She buys her products locally from wholesalers. She sells her products to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash and often on credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 FCFA that she will use to cover healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses. She will reinvest the remaining amount into her business.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en: Eseese is a 34 year old single woman with 4 children. She operates a lawnmowing business and also fishes and sell fish to the public and around her community. She has been doing this for 3 years. Eseese has requested a loan to buy 2 new lawnmowers, fishing nets, fishing equipments and boots. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, plans to expand her business and also improve her family's living standards especially providing a good education for her kids.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and gears, fishing boots, coolers, 2 lawn mowers, lawnmower strings

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  40ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DALLAN l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des ustensiles, des habits et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. FAFOUNE 1ère femme  debout à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 15 chemises, 15 robes, 20 pantalons et 20 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 21 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya Group average 40 years of age and 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Dallan, a neighbourhood in the city of San in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The women know each other through family ties and make a living trading utensils, clothes and various products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Danaya Group are on their 7th solidarity loan cycle. Fafoune is the woman standing on the left-hand side of the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 15 shirts, 15 dresses, 20 pairs of trousers and 20 scarves. She buys her products locally. She sells her products to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash and often on credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 21 000 FCFA that she will use to cover healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses. She will reinvest the remaining amount into her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: 3.5.1006.2.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase general household commodities to resell.

Hiền is 41 years old, married, and has no children. She is the group leader of the 3.5.1006.2.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of six members. Hiền supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase general household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Iva

texts.en: Iva is  40 years old with 10 children. She wishes to expand her elei design small business, selling around her community and deliver them to shops. In order to do this, Iva needs a loan to purchase painting tools, new design prints, fabric, fabric paint, a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her family needs and reinvest it back to her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy painting tools and design..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana was born in 1990. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a warehouse secretary. 
Rana has been helping her husband to improve their living conditions for one year by purchasing cosmetic products from outside the country and reselling them in Jordan. Now she is requesting a youth loan to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics in order to respond to her customer's requests and to start selling them in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: 3.5.1008.10.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Hải is 50 years old and she is married with no children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Mrs. Hải works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hải is the group leader of the 3.5.1008.10.thiệu Trung Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. In 2012, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hải has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hải has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hải faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hải hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Fanta, a busy 40-year-old business woman from rural Waterloo, Eastern of Freetown city. 

Fanta is married to a local driver. They have five children. Fanta first set up her stall in the local market in 2004. She works from 8 am every morning until 5:30 pm and then returns to look after her family. 

Fanta sells clothes, many of which are made with a brightly printed (and very durable) local fabric called ‘wax cotton’. Although Fanta is proud of her business, she says the inflation of local prices is a big challenge. 

Fanta is a BRAC Sierra Leone success story, as she has taken and paid back five previous loans, all of which have helped her to grow her business.  Fanta would like to use this loan to buy more clothing material to sell at her stall. She thanks you for helping her.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies that will help care for and maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Alisi

texts.en: Alisi is 46 years old and married with 5 children. She has a flowering garden where she sells them at the market or to the people who come over to place their orders with her.She also has pop plants that she sells. She has been doing this for 2 years. Alisi flowering business is doing well, but she needs a loan to pay for her kids school fees (one is attending university and the other is attending college) and also cements to patch up her home repairs.She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. Alisi uses her profits to reinvest it into her business and also to cater for her family's immediate needs.

loans.use: to pay for her kids school fees, cement (bricks)

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es: Rosa tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y se dedica a la venta de bebidas y recargas desde hace más de 2 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Rosa ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su vivienda en el repello de las paredes dado que no cuentan con una protección y están expuestas a deterioros. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento que es el material necesario para proceder al repello de las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa is 21 years old, and lives in her own home with her family.  She has been engaged in selling beverages and chargers for more than two years.  She is an enterprising woman who wishes to improve living conditions for herself and her family.  Rosa has decided to invest in her home by plastering the walls because they do not have protection and are vulnerable to damage.  For the above-mentioned, she is requesting a loan through Fusai to invest in the purchase of sand and cement, the materials she needs to proceed with plastering her home’s walls.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to plaster her homes's walls.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin was born in 1986. She is married and lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband is working in construction. 

Yasmin has been working at selling clothes for three years. She is planning to expand her project by increasing the amount of purchases and the number of customers during the summer. She is requesting a youth loan to be able to buy a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of clothes

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hard working mother from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three children. She raises and sells pigs. Aside from raising hogs, she also engages in a food vending business. She has been operating both businesses more than a few years. She is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed and more ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, flour and butter to increase her sales and thus to be able to meet the family’s daily needs. 

Mary Jane would like to continue improving her business so that she can give her family a comfortable life and a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and more ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, flour and butter

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Celina de 42 anos de idade, viuva e mae de 2 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è empacotadora de banana numa empresa de producao da banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a construcao de sua casa.
Tem como trabalhar arduamente para concluir o emprestimo e poder ceder o outro
texts.en:
Celina is 42 years old and a widow. She has two children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. She packs bananas for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so that she can start building her house.
She intends to work very hard in order to repay the loan and be able to apply for another one.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so that she can start building her house.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne  38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DALLAN l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur  6ème  prêt solidaire. MINATA 2ème femme  à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1carton de savon, 10 jouets pour enfants, 10 boites de pommade et 10 chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The DJIGUIYA group consists of women who average 38 years of age and three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in DALLAN, a district of the city of SAN, in SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they conduct commercial activities involving the purchase and sale of miscellaneous products. 

This is the Djiguiya group’s 6th group loan cycle; all past loans were correctly repaid. Minata, 2nd from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 1 carton of soap, 10 children’s toys, 10 cartons of pomade and 10 pairs of plastic shoes. She buys her merchandise locally from wholesalers, and sells it to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash, though often on credit.

Minata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which she will use to cover expenses pertaining to healthcare, food, clothing, and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Alex Jesus

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alex en su negocio de confección de bolsos y sus derivados, porque con su crédito pudo comprar lona, gomas, hilo, cuero etc. Su producción fue mayor y así mismo fueron sus ventas y esto fue gracias al credikiva que llegó a sus manos de manera oportuna. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará una bordadora, maquinaria que mejorará la calidad de sus productos, adicionándole valor por su acabado. También comprará nuevamente materia prima porque tiene encargados muchos bolsos con nuevos diseños lo cual hace de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Alex with his business making purses and other products. With his loan he bought canvas material, thread and leather. He was able to produce more and sell more. This was all thanks to the Kiva loan that came into his hands in an opportune moment. 

Currently he is requesting a new loan through which he will buy an embroidery machine that will improve the quality of his products and adding greater value to his finished product. He will also buy new material because he has orders for many purses with new designs that will make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and material to make purses.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She lives with her family in the town of Albur, Bohol. She has been operating her store for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.
Saturnina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to expand her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers. In the future, Saturnina hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a married woman from the town of Panglao,Bohol. She has a 9-year-old son. She is into raising and selling hogs. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets to fatten and sell, earning income to pay for school fees and food for the family.

 She hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for the welfare of her child to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
Dromo Group consists of four people who live in the same community and are part of the same network of women. They get together each week to meet and receive training and also arrange repayment of loans for those who are due. They sell fruits, groceries, noddles, phone card credits and porridge.
The featured borrower is Mary, who is standing on the right in the photo. She is involved in the sale of pineapples, watermelons, pawpaw and bananas. She is requesting GHS 900 to buy more pineapples, watermelons, pawpaw and bananas. She supports her husband in the management of daily expenses and the school fees of her children. She starts her day at 7 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. at night. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve the nutritional condition of her family. The group needs a total amount of GHS 3200 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy and sell pineapples, watermelons, pawpaw and bananas.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of four. Her husband is a retired man. Hana has been supporting her husband with the household expenses for eight years by sewing clothes at her house. 

Hana is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing machines and fabric in order to raise her productivity and profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines and fabric for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar nutrients, etc. for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lucelinda

texts.en:
Lucelinda is a retailer/dealer of food supplements. She lives in the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. 

Lucelinda has been in the business for more than a year now, and this is the source of her income. 

She needs a loan for the expansion of her business.

Lucelinda is asking for a loan to increase her stock of food supplements. 

With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food supplements

loans.name: Marlon Rafael

texts.es: Marlon tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 12 años, 7 años y 6 meses de edad. Marlon es un hombre muy trabajador quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ganarse el sustento diario. Marlon  se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace mucho tiempo y desea construir un cuarto dormitorio con el fin de dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y madera.
texts.en:
Marlon is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their three children. They have a six-month old and two older children, ages twelve and seven. Marlon is a very hard worker and does everything in his power to make a daily living. He works providing security services and has been doing this for many years. 

Marlon wants to build a bedroom in order to give his children better living conditions. That is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI, so that he can invest it in buying cement, sand, bricks, iron, and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and wood to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a hard workingwoman from Panglao, Bohol. She is the mother of a 13-year-old son. She has a scrap buying and recycling business. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs as an additional source of income. 

Leoncia is asking for a loan to buy more recyclable materials and scrap to increase her stock thus generating a higher income.  

Leoncia would like to continue improving her business so that she can give her children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials and scrap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Maria Karen

texts.es:
María es una señora de 20 años, madre soltera, tiene una nena de 3 años, juntas viven en Santo Domingo una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, con un clima agradable. Ciudad conocida también porque en este sector habita la etnia Tsachila por ello el nombre de la ciudad. 
María es una señora muy trabajadora, para sacar adelante a su hija se puso un pequeño negocio, ella vende cosméticos hace 3 años, lo realiza recorriendo a su clientela fija, les visita de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos; también vende ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Le ha ido muy bien y se ha dado cuenta que no contar con el padre de su hija no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante. María desea incrementar sus ingresos, para ello necesita comprar interiores, calcetines, perfumes y cosméticos para ofrecer a su clientela. María trabaja con Fundación Alternativa hace un año, se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida. Ahora se le pudo ayudar con un crédito el cual lo invertirá en cosméticos y mercadería ya que se acerca la temporada estudiantil y es muy buena para las ventas. Agradece mucho a la institución y al proyecto Kiva ya que ha podido progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and a single mother of a three-year-old girl. They live together in Santo Domingo, a very commercial and productive city with nice weather. The city is also known for being the location of the Tsachila ethnic, for which the city is named after. 

Maria is a hard-working woman who set up a business to support her daughter. She has been selling cosmetics for three years. She carries her work by following up with her established customers, visiting them house to house to offer them products. She also sells underwear for women, men and children. The business has gone very well for her. She has learned not to rely on the father of her daughter and to not let him be an impediment to her moving forward. Maria hopes to increase her earnings, for which she must buy underwear, socks, perfumes and cosmetics to sell to her clients.

Maria has been with Fundación Alternativa for one year and feels very grateful. She has been able to improve her standard of living beecause of the loans. Now she would like to receive a loan to invest in cosmetics and merchandise. The school season is now approaching and is a good time for sales. She is thankful to the institution and project with Kiva because she has been able to make progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help protect her coffee farm in the upcoming growing season

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañileria. 

Ana se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto a su esposo  para realizar las actividades diarias mientras sus hijos van a la escuela. Ana se dedica a trabajar en un Chalet que posee, mientras su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil.	

El prestamo solicitado, lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para su cafetin y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Ana planea ampliar su negocio y sabe que lo lograra con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de golosinas, hamburgesas, etc  y de los ingresos de su esposo y tambien con la ayuda de los creditos.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking thirty-year-old woman.  She completed her high school education.  She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.

She gets up at 5:00 a.m. along with her husband to complete the daily chores, while her children go to school.  She runs her own small cafe.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her cafe and thus increase her income.

Ana plans to expand her business, and she knows that she will accomplish this based on the income that she gains from selling candy, hamburgers and other items.  Her husband's income, and this loan, will also help her with this goal.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her cafe.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad. Él y su compañera de vida habitan en condiciones muy humildes por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para  la construcción de las paredes de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la mejora de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Manuel is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. Manuel is a very hard worker and has a job providing security services. He and his partner live in very humble conditions, which is why he made the decision of requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest it in purchasing sheet metal and wood to build the walls of his house. He hopes to get the loan so that he can start improving his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to build the walls of his house.

loans.name: Eustiquia

texts.en:
Eustiquia is a merchant from the town of Tiptip District, Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is married with two children aged 22 and six years old respectively. Her husband works as a driver to support their family. She sells various snack foods like chips, biscuits, ice candy, juices and many others to the school canteen within their community.  Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various stock and more ingredients for food vending to augment her income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy various stock and more ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has operated a food business in San Miguel, Bohol for more than 15 years now. She is married with two adult children. 

Alejandra is currently engaged in food vending, and she sells ice candy (Popsicles), rice cakes (sweetened sticky rice) and pancakes. This is the source of her income.

Alejandra wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. 

So, she is requesting a loan with CEVI to buy cooking oil, sticky rice and sugar. 

Through this loan, Alejandra will have all the ingredients she needs for her food vending business, which allows her to cook and sell more. 

In the future, Alejandra hopes she making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sticky rice and sugar

loans.name: Ginamarie

texts.en:
Ginamarie is a 34-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with two young children, ages 7 and 1 year old. Her husband worked in a private company to support their family. 

She makes native baskets and sells nipa palm leaves (used as roofing for typical Filipino houses). Her business started quite a few years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like nito, ratan (dried palm) and nipa palm, to continue her livelihood activity, as well as increase her earnings.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito, ratan (dried palm) and nipa palm

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 67 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, actualmente esta casado y  vive junto a su esposa e hijos.

 Pedro se levanta a las 4:30 AM Junto a su esposa e hijos que le ayudan en la actividades agrícolas, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, para llegar a la parcelas camina 2  Km, trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica tambien a los oficios domésticos.

El credito que esta solicitando, lo necesita para comprar una novilla, ya que en un futuro le ayudara para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para la manutención de su familia

Entre sus planes a futuro esta, comprar mas ganado con las ganancias que obtenga de la venta de leche y de la siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro is 67 years old and has only a sixth-grade education.  He is married and lives with his wife and children.

He learned to farm from his parents. He wakes up at 4:30 am along with his wife and children, who help him with his farming activities. They have to walk two kilometers to reach their fields.  He works there during the morning while his wife attends to the needs of the household.

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase a dairy cow.  This will help him to increase his production of the milk that he sells and to obtain additional income to support his family.

In the future, he plans to purchase more livestock with the profits he is earning from the sale of his milk and his crops.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meris Idania

texts.es:
Meris de 19 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente ella esta acompañada y su pareja esta postrado en una cama debido a un accidente vehicular, tiene un  hijo el cual esta estudiando en la escuela.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años que fue cuando su pareja sufrió el terrible accidente, entonces decidió poner la venta de tortillas, anteriormente ya había tenido experiencia en esta actividad con su madre quien fue vendedora de tortillas, ella tiene la venta en su casa y la gente llega a comprar todos los días.
Ella solicita este crédito, para comprar una cocina industrial para mejorar su negocio ya que ella ha estado haciendo sus tortillas en comal de barro, la cual le servirá de mucho porque podrá vender mas  tortillas en menos tiempo y también podrá pagar el tratamiento de su pareja  para que se mejore.
El sueño de Meris es que su pareja pueda recuperarse y asi poder trabajar juntos, ella vendiendo tortillas y el con su antiguo empleo de estructuras metalicas, pero tambien tiene otro gran sueño que su hijo, que su hijo puede continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Meris is 19 years old and has just a third grade education. She has a partner, who is currently on bed rest due to a car accident, and she has a son who is currently in school.  

She started her tortilla selling business 3 years ago, when her partner was in the terrible accident so she decided to start selling tortillas. She had prior experience with the activity, since her mother sold tortillas. She sells from her home and people arrive to buy from her each day. 

She is requesting this loan to buy an industrial stove to improve her business, since she has been making her tortillas on a clay griddle. The stove will be very useful to her, since she will be able to sell tortillas in less time and will also be able to pay for her partner's treatment so that he gets better. Meris' dream is for her partner to recover so that they can work together, she selling tortillas and he with his old metal structure business. She also has another great dream, which is that her son be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
Adriana Mercedes es una señora de 44 años, casada, madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos a su cargo uno de ellos estudiando en la universidad y el otro en primaria.
Se desempeña como profesora de primaria en una escuela del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene más de veinte años, profesión que le ha permitido sacar adelante su familia, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con la ayuda de los préstamos.
Es una profesora muy querida por sus alumnos por su carisma y paciencia para enseñarles a leer y escribir.
La profesora Adriana necesita en este momento un crédito para compra de medicamentos y realización de exámenes para mejorar su salud, con el fin de sentirse bien para ejercer mejor su trabajo.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyen su solicitud para que a través de Ceprodel le otorguen el crédito y así poder mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Adriana Mercedes is 44 years old and is married with three children.  Two of them still live at home - one of these is in college and the other is in primary school.

She works hard as an elementary school teacher in a school in the municipality of El Sauce, where she has more than twenty years of experience. This profession, along with the help of loans, has allowed her to provide a better life for her family and to make improvements to her home. 

She is very much loved my her students, since she is charismatic and patient as she teaches them to read and write.

At this moment she needs a loan in order to purchase medicines and to pay for medical exams in an effort to improve her health.  Her goal is to be able to feel healthy and perform her job better.

She hopes and trusts in God that the Kiva investors will support her in this loan request, which is being facilitated through Ceprodel.  This will enable her to improve her health.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been working in the fishing business along with her husband for more than eight years now. She is also engaged in seaweed farming. 

Gonzala works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her family.

Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings, and to pay the school fees of her children. 

With this, she will be able to improve her fishing and seaweed farming business, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings, and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is a married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She is a merchant who sells vegetables to the people in her place. She sells various vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, and onions, and fruit like bananas, among others. She has been in the business for several years now.

Flordelisa is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. 

With this, she will be able to improve her sales and income. Flordelisa is hopeful that one day, her business will improve and become more productive.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her soap making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials for her business

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 41-year-old married woman. She is supporting her husband and her three girls and two boys with her work in her food market. 

Now Huda wants to improve her store by doing some decorating to it, painting it, and purchasing more food products, so she can attract more customers and raise her profit. 

She doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for her mini market, and do some decorating in the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Blema Tessa and their average age is 42 years old with two children, all living in same area in Teshie.  They work with the ID-Ghana micro finance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time.  They are on their forth loan with this institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

La (the first person standing on the right in the photo) will use her loan to buy two Kente (African fabric) and sell it daily at her residence.  She buys her Kente from Kumasi and sell at her residence.  She is 56 years and has one daughter.  She expects to achieve good monthly profit from this loan. This profit will enable her to reimburse the loan and also take care of her daily expenses.  They need a total amount of GHS 4,200 to buy enough to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy two Kente (African fabric) and sell it daily at her residence.

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en: Ronna is a married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years now together with her husband. This is the source of their income. Ronna is asking for a loan to buy materials to repair the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to improve the working condition of the fishing boat. In the future, Ronna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a single mother of four children; three of her children go to school. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in his business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO in order to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from selling used shoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is thirty seven years old. He sells ladies hand bags and school bags in the market. He works seven days a week and twelve hours a day. He started this business in 2006 to improve his family's welfare. High transportation costs and license fees affect his business since he has to move to different places thus incurring unnecessary costs.

loans.use: to buy ladies hand bags and school bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maggi cub, onion, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sulainah

texts.en: Sulainah is acquiring a loan to purchase more cups, plates, dishes and saucepans to sell. She has sold home utensils since 2010. She started this business to improve her family's welfare. She lives in Hoima, Uganda and she is thirty years old. Sulainah is a hardworking lady who desires to expand her business and raise it to a standard of a well-established supermarket to attract more customers and increase her sales and profits. Debtors affect her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates, dishes and saucepans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap to attract her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm, oil, maggi cub, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more iron for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to sell

loans.name: Joaquín Humberto

texts.es:
Joaquin tiene 60 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que ya están casados y ya no viven con el, lamentablemente su esposa falleció de una enfermedad respiratoria hace un par de años, y ahora solo vive con una nieta.
Joaquin se dedica al cultivo de maíz, desde que era muy pequeño sus padres dejaron de mandarlo a la escuela y lo ponian a trabajar, ahora también tiene una vaca la cual cuida para sacarle provecho de la leche ya que su nieta sale a venderla todas las tardes en la comunidad.
El prestamo que esta solicitando, lo necesita para invertir en la siembra de dos hectareas de maíz, lo cual no es tan fácil por la época de verano porque son siembras de regadillo, y para ello necesita el crédito para poder sacar la cosecha y solo sera posible con la ayuda del credito.  

Su sueño es poder cultivar cuatro hectareas de tierra mas,  le ayudara a mejorar  sus ingresos ya que no puede hacer las actividades como cuando era mas joven, por eso para el próximo año necesitara la ayuda de algunos agricultores que prestan sus servicios para ayudar a sacar la cosecha del cultivo y asi poder tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Joaquin, age 60, has three children who are married and do not live with him.  Sadly, his wife died from a respiratory illness a few years ago.  Now he only lives with a granddaughter.

Joaquin has been growing corn ever since he was very little.  His parents did not send him to school, and they put him to work.  He also now has a cow, which he cares for in order to take advantage of the milk.  His granddaughter goes out into the community to sell the milk every afternoon.

He needs the loan that he is requesting to invest in growing two hectares of corn.  This is not so easy during the summer season because corn is an irrigated crop.  For this he needs the loan to be able to get the harvest.  This will only be possible with the help of the loan. 

His dream is to be able to cultivate four more hectares of land.  It will help him to improve his income because he is no longer able to do the business activities like when he was younger.  Therefore, in the next year he will need the help of some farmers to lend their services to help harvest the crop.  This way he will be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to invest in growing two hectares of corn.

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
The members of the Mandzaano Group are married women who on average are 45 years old and both live in same area in Teshie.

They work with the ID Ghana so they can carry out their activities. They are on their seventh loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Cynthia (the person standing on the left in the photo) will use her loan to buy two cartons of fish and to smoke and sell them in the market. She buys her fish from the cold store and smokes and sells them in the market. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school.

She expects to achieve a good monthly profit from this loan. This profit will enable her to reimburse the loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

They need a total amount of GHS 2,300 to buy enough fish to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish and to smoke and sell them in the market.

loans.name: Universal 2 Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. They are involved in the sale of scarves, African fabrics, oranges, cassava, plantains, and flour.

Gladys is the representative of the group (the person standing in the middle of the photo). She is 56 years old and has not attended school.

Gladys has no dependent child and she has been selling foodstuffs for 8 years. She will use her share of the loan to buy oranges, plantains, and cassava to sell to her customers at her residence.

To bolster her business, Gladys, along with the other group members, is requesting her sixth loan from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains, and cassava to sell to her customers at her residence

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new food products for her mini-market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cow skin to attract her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies once again to care for her coffee crop during this new season.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarm City. He lives with his family in a small simple house. One year ago, Mahmoud opened a small store selling gifts and accessories in the city. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to buy a new collection of accessories and gifts. 

Mahmoud would like to take a bigger loan in the future to expand his store. Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more gifts and accessories to resell in his store

loans.name: Edwin Noel

texts.es:
Edwin de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, su esposa se dedica al trabajo del hogar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor de 8 años asiste a la escuela estudia tercer grado. Edwin tiene 7 años de trabajar en la alcaldía de la ciudad, también trabaja en la siembra de maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar material de trabajo para el cultivo, como abono y fertilizantes, desea seguir trabajando y poder darle a su familia una casa digna, ya que ellos viven en casa de adobe y lamina y darle el estudio adecuado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 32, went to school through the sixth grade.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  He has three children.  The oldest, age eight, goes to school and is in the third grade.

Edwin has been working for city hall for seven years.  He also works growing corn.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy work materials for the crop.  He will buy things like compost and fertilizers.  He wishes to continue working and to be able to give his family a decent house.  This is because they live in a house made from adobe and corrugated metal sheeting.  He also wishes to give his children an adequate education.

loans.use: to buy things like compost and fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, rice, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta de 34 años de edad,  es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja se dedica al enderezado y pintura de carros, negocio que maneja por cuenta propia. Viven en una casa que hace poco hicieron en un terreno que les heredó la mamá de su compañero de vida, viven 6 en total, sus cuatro hijos de 17, 14, 11 y 6 años de edad están estudiando, pero la mayor está próxima a salir y espera trabajar para aportar en la casa.

Marta tiene amplia experiencia en la tortillería, desde que se acompañó a los 18 años de edad, decidió abrir el puesto de tortillería, se puede decir que es un oficio familiar pues lo aprendió de su madre, viene de generación en generación. El puesto  le queda a 10 minutos de distancia caminando, tiene tan solo una trabajadora que le ayuda.

Marta ha solicitado un préstamo a CREDICAMPO,  pues necesita comprar una nueva plancha donde hacer las tortillas, debido a que la que tiene actualmente está muy deteriorada y aunque su esposo la ha intentado arreglar, siempre le da problema. Además desea comprar un poco de leña y maíz para su negocio.
Marta sueña con ver que sus hijos se superen y sean unos buenos ciudadanos. También quiere ampliar el negocio e ir creciendo de manera que pudiera tener más puestos de tortillería.
texts.en:
Marta is 34 years old and is an optimistic, hard-working woman. She is happy in her relationship, and her partner works in auto body work and car painting, a business that he manages himself. They live in a house that they recently built on land that they inherited from her life partner's mother. They live there with their four children who are 17, 14, 11 and 6 years old.  All of them are in school, but the oldest one is about to finish and hopes to work so he can contribute to the household finances.
