Marta has a lot of experience as a tortilla maker. When she settled down with her partner at the age of 18, she decided to open a tortilla stand. You can say that it's a family trade because she learned it from her mother and is going from generation to generation. The stand is 10 minutes by foot from her house and she has only one worker who helps her. 

Marta has asked CREDICAMPO for a loan because she needs to buy a new griddle to make the tortillas because the one she has now is not in good condition. Although her husband has tried to fix it, it keeps on giving her problems. Additionally, she would like to buy some wood and corn for her business. Marta dreams of seeing her children improve themselves and become good citizens.  She also wants to expand her business and have more tortilla stands.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn, and a new griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora del nivel secundario,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo,la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de reagalos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un artefacto para su casa un televisor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member, Elizabeth, continues to work as a high school teacher and has been doing this for a number of years. Through her job, she has been able to bring up her children. Her dream is to have a gift shop.

Elizabeth is requesting the loan so she can buy an appliance for her home - a television. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Erdenetsog

texts.en: Mr. Erdenetsog, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as electricity engineer at power station since 2007. His wife is studying at teacher college to become preschool education provider. But due to lack of cash, his wife stopped going to college. So he is requesting a loan of 450 USD to pay for his wife's tuition fee. As a result, his wife can obtain the necessary knowledge for becoming teacher and then will contribute to family well being. The borrower is very hardworking individual who supports his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Greens Konammadevi - Kiresur Group

texts.en:
Kamalavva, the head of the Greens Konammadevi Joint Liability Group (JLG), is standing with her hand raised. She lives in Kiresur, Bagalkot, Karnataka with her husband and three children. Her husband works as a driver. One of her sons works as a daily wage worker in the agriculture fields while the other two go to school. 

Kamalavva owns a sheep raising farm. She also works in the fields as a daily wage worker and earns Rs 100 per day. The income is used to take care of the household expenses and for her children's education. She is now experiencing difficulty with the escalation of all daily use commodities.

She is trying to develop a sheep raising farm by borrowing a loan. Kamalavva will use her loan to buy lambs and raise them. She can make a profit of Rs 8,000 – 10,000 per lamb. Kamalavva dreams that this business will become a major source of income. She even wants to send her children to a better school. 

The group consists of four other members. All are involved in the same business and are looking forward to this loan.

loans.use: to purchase lambs

loans.name: Greens Dhigambereshwara-Salagundi Group

texts.en:
The women of the “Greens Dhigambereshwara” Joint Liability Group (JLG) are from the small village of Salagundhi, Bagalkot, Karnataka. The group is composed of five women who earn their living by raising animals like goats, sheep and rams and they also work in the agriculture fields as laborers. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with “Future Greens”. They are excited and hopeful to begin this new loan with goals and dreams.

Yallavva is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. Two of her children are laborers in the agriculture fields while the other two go to school. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Yallavva. Due to the poor economic condition of her family, she didn’t climb the stairs of school and had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of “Future Greens”, Yallavva realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her children.
                                                                                                                                                                    
She shares that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her child in a good school this year! Her husband shares the same goals for the child. Yallavva has a sheep and goat rearing farm. Her husband also works in the agriculture fields and earns INR 150 per day.
                                                                                                                                                                                         
The requested loan will be used to buy lambs to raise. On behalf of her colleagues, Yallavva expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Greens Shraddhananada-Bandakeri Group

texts.en:
Six women from the small village of Bandakeri, Bagalkot, Karnataka have come together to set up their microenterprises. They have named their Joint Liability Group (JLG) “Greens Shraddhananada”.

Renuka, their group leader, is holding her son and has her hand raised. She is married and her son is studying in the first standard. Her husband works in the agriculture fields as a laborer and they have a small house. Her husband’s income is not enough for the family. She wants her son to have a modern education and for that, they need more income.

To have her dream come true, Renuka took training from a local NGO ‘Future Greens’ to set up a sheep-rearing farm. This venture has given her profits, but not enough. She now seeks a loan to buy more livestock to boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Fredys Isaias

texts.es:
Fredys de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, él es empleado de la alcaldía, desde hace varios años trabaja la agricultura y la ganadera, necesita.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado, pesticidas y fertilizantes, para seguir trabajando y poder comprar más ganado y hacer más grande su patrimonio para que en su vejez poder dedicarse al trabajo propio.
texts.en:
Fredys is 25 years old.  He studied through ninth grade.  His wife takes care of their home and he works for the town hall.  For many years, he has also worked in farming and raising livestock.

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase livestock, pesticides, and fertilizers to continue working.  He wants to purchase more livestock and make his legacy larger so that in old age, he can focus on his own work.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, pesticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
This is Eulalia, 24, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ulpiano, a driver and they have children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Eulalia is a retailer who sells soap, detergent powder and fabric conditioner. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more soap, detergent powder and fabric softener for her business.

Eulalia dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more soap, detergent powder and fabric softener for her business.

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es: Natividad de 54 años es casada y tiene 04 hijos independientes, ella es integrante del grupo “Manuela Ramos” conformada por 06 socias entusiastas que han demostrado ser responsables. Natividad se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. El deseo de Natividad es de incrementar el volumen de sus productos, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Su reciente crédito los destinará para la compra de polos, pantalones y medias. El grupo “Manuela Ramos” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Natividad es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo violeta.
texts.en:
Natividad is 54 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She is a member of the Manuela Ramos group, which is made up of six enthusiastic members who have demonstrated their responsibility.  Natividad works selling clothing.  She wants to increase the volume of her products to ensure that she will have more profits.  Her recent loan will be used to purchase shirts, pants, and socks.  

The Manuela Ramos group is grateful for the loan provided and promises to continue working well.  Natividad is the first on the left side in the purple shirt.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, and socks.

loans.name: Bhishmilla - Jalageri Group

texts.en:
“Bhishmilla” is the name of this Joint Liability Group (JLG), which is located in Jalageri village, Bagalkot, Karnataka. Ashabi is the featured member (with her hand raised). She has become a role model for her village because she formed the group and came forward to take this loan to buy sheep and goats. Including Ashabi, the group consists of eight members.

Ashabi is a mother of four children and all are studying in a government school. Her husband is working in the agriculture fields as a laborer and earns INR 150 per day. She has a farm consisting of sheep and goats. She has been doing this business for some time. She raises the animals in her home yard and takes the fully-grown rams, sheep and goats to the weekly market to sell them or sometimes people buy directly from her house. She is planning to do some savings with the group members. The savings will be beneficial when they can’t earn or engage themselves in any other form of income-generating activity. Ashabi also shares that her savings will act as a pension for her family once she gets old. 

These women find Future Greens, MicroGraam and Kiva lenders to be a blessing for the group and are looking forward to getting help from them.  They will do their best to work in unity and to keep their word.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Lakshmi

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a 27-year-old widow living with her father and two children in a small village in the Koraput District of Odisha, India. She is engaged in a food stall where she sells breakfast and snacks and earns 3,000 INR per month. She wants to expand her business so that she can make more money and can get her children admitted in a school.

She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. After her husband's death, she took over responsibility for all the family. She has applied for a loan to purchase a refrigerator so that she can sell cold drinks and milk-made foods.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for her food stall.

loans.name: Greens Konammadevi-Jalihal Group

texts.en:
Greens Konammadevi is a Joint Liability Group (JLG) with five members. The group is mentored by the local NGO Future Greens Samsthe.  The group is based in the small village of Jalihal in Bagalkot District. Basically, all the people in this village are dependent on agriculture and work in the fields as day laborers. Many villagers get involved in lamb and goat rearing as an additional source of income because what they earn is not sufficient to take care of the family needs. Most of the people in this village are from a marginalized section of society.

Konammadevi is the name of a goddess; the bull is the vehicle of this goddess. The group is named after this goddess.

Kamalavva, 28 years old and the lady standing with her hand raised, is the leader of this group. She has finished her schooling until second grade. She could not continue her studies further as her parents were very poor and could not afford her school fees. She is married and is living in a small hut with her husband and a daughter who studying in first grade. 

Kamalavva is requesting a loan to start raising lambs and goats. With the profit that she expects from this activity, she wants to build a house and provide the quality education to her daughter that she never received.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and goats

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Yamuna is 35 years old and a widow living with her three children in a small village in the Koraput District of Odisha, India. She owns a chicken center where she sells chicken meat and she runs a tea stall where she sells tea, biscuits and some snack items. Both businesses were run by her husband and are now run by Yamuna after the death of her husband. Her elder son helps her in this business. She wants to open a fast food corner where she can sell noodles, rolls etc.

She has applied for a loan to purchase a refrigerator, a showcase, a gas cylinder and raw materials to make fast food. She has committed to pay back her loan on time. She is happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, a showcase, a gas cylinder and raw materials to make fast food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Alafou

texts.en: Alafou is 46 years old with 5 children. She operates a flea market stall at the market, selling items such as lavalava, shirts, make ups, souvenier and etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Alafou needs a loan to provide more exciting products to improve the quality of her business.She wants to buy handicrafted items such as tapa cloths, shell earings, necklaces, fans, grass skirts, bangoes etc. She hopes to gain more profits and plans to improve her family's quality of life, especially her kids. She has just joined the the SPBD program to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy handicrafted tapa cloths, shell earings, necklaces, fans, grass skirts, bangoes

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KARANTELA l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, de savons, des habits et des fruits légumes.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. BARO 2ème femme  assise à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 2 paniers de banane, 3 paniers de papaye. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who make up the Tiessiri group are 32 years old on average and they also have an average of three children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Karantela, one of the neighborhoods of the city of San, located in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family ties and they are involved in retail, buying and selling condiments, soaps, clothes, as well as fruits and vegetables.  They have duly repaid their previous loans and are now taking their second solidarity loan.

Baro (second from the left in the front row), is planning to use her loan to buy two baskets of bananas and three baskets of papaya.  She buys her goods locally and resells them to men and women who pay her in cash and also often on credit. 

Baro is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of health, schooling and housing-related expenses, and to buy food and clothes.  She will reinvest the rest of her money in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits (bananas and papaya).

loans.name: Greens Valmiki - Jalageri Group

texts.en:
“Greens Valmiki” Joint Liability Group (JLG) consists of five women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They all faced a lack of resources for a worthy life, so they planned to start a sheep and goat-rearing business.

One of them is Hajaratabi who was elected as their president. She is standing with her hand raised in the photo. Hajaratabi is a 28-year-old lady living with her husband and three sons. One of her sons works in horticulture and picks betel leaves while the other two go to school. Her husband works in the agriculture fields as a laborer and earns INR 150 per day. Hajaratabi does goat and sheep rearing to help her husband financially. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers who buy sheep and goats in the village. She has requested a loan to purchase more sheep and goats. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s economic condition and bring more stability. Lending to this group is being part of the change so much needed in these communities.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Hemangini

texts.en:
Hemangini is 32 years old and a widow who lives with her parents-in-laws and two children in a village called Dhepaguda in the Koraput district of Odiha, India. Her children go to a government school near her house. She is engaged in a tailoring business from which she is earning 4,000 INR per month. After the death of her husband, all the family responsibility automatically came to her shoulders and 4,000 INR is insufficient for her family's monthly family expenditures.

She has applied for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, threads and cloth so that she can give tailoring training to others and can make some extra money. She hopes to educate her children and wants to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, threads and cloth

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a man of 32 years, married to Salome and a father of three children. He runs a barber shop in Kabuku on the outskirts of Limuru. He has been in this business for eight years and gets a monthly income of 5,450 KES.

This will be Stephen's eighth loan with Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to pay for school fees. He wants to expand his business and educate his children in the future.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Nakouma

texts.fr: Monsieur Nakouma  est un homme marié de 43 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père à Bougouni Dialanikoro. Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après mure réflexion, il décide d’apprendre auprès de son ami  la commercialisation des  téléphones portables.Après avoir eu un petit fonds de roulement à travers un ami il décide de commencer cette activité c’est à dire l’achat et la vente des téléphones portables. Avec une expériences de plus de 6 ans, il maîtrise son activité.Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers un agent de l’institution  pour prendre un prêt. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt il compte acheter 15 téléphones portables, 15 batterie et 10 chargeurs. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et la vente se fait dans sa boutique située à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est mixte. Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA. C’est avec ses intérêts qu’il compte payer le prêt, subvenir à ses besoins et à agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en: Nakouma is 43 years old, married and the father of three children.  He lives with his wife and children in his father's house in Bougouni Dialanikoro.  He attended Koranic school but then was unemployed for a long period of time.  After careful consideration though, he decided to learn how to buy and sell cellular phones from one of his friends.  After receiving a small working capital from a friend, he decided to start working in this particular field.  Nakouma now has more than 6 years of experience and knows his business quite well.  In order to boost his activity, and having heard about Soro Yiriwaso through one of its representatives, he decided to join this microfinance institution and to take a loan.  This is Nakouma's first experience with Soro Yiriwaso.  With this loan, he is planning to buy 15 cellular phones, 15 batteries and 10 chargers.  He buys his merchandise in Bamako and resells in his own shop in Bougouni, to both men and women.  Thanks to this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, which will help him to repay his loan, meet his needs and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase Gas stove, gas, cooking oil, flour, baking powder, sugar, 2 large bins (plastic containers)

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is divorced with one child who attends school.  She does not take care of any additional family members. Juliet has operated a restaurant business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more green bananas, beef, rice, and potatoes.  She sells on a retail basis six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

Juliet aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, beef, rice, and potatoes.

loans.name: Tiperia

texts.en: Tiperia is 32 years old, married with 1 child. She runs a small food stall selling BBQ in her community and to the public. She has been doing this for 4 years. Tiperia has requested a loan to buy to buy 3 large pots, 1 large frying pan for her business, and timber and iron roofing to renovate her home. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tiperia will look at improving her business and also help her family and kids .

loans.use: to buy 3 large pots, 1 large frying pan, timber, iron roofing

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: Abdulrahman is 22 years old.  He lives with his 6 member family.  Abdulrahman is a university student majoring in Persian Language.  He is in his last year and is only one step away from graduation.  His aim is to support his family by working in his studied field after graduation.  His parents are not able to pay for his upcoming semester fees, so he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao is a 36 year old married woman with 3 children. She sells pancakes to the people in her village and school kids, and has been doing this for 2 years. Logotaeao has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour,sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, 2 large frying pans, gas stove, gas, and also needs to pay shool fees for her kids. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Logotaeo will be able to provide necessities for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour,sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, 2 large frying pans, gas stove, gas, shool fees.and ingredients for making her bakery

loans.name: Lavalea

texts.en: Lavalea  is a 39 years old woman with 8 children. She runs a small food stall business selling snacks, pastries, sandwiches to the school children and people around her village. She has been doing this for 3 years. Lavalea has requested a loan to to pay for her children's school fees, to buy timber, bricks, nails, steel for her home improvement. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lavalea has managed to provide things necessary for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, to buy timber, bricks, nails, steel

loans.name: Walter  Simon

texts.es:
El socio Walte Simon se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesor del nivel primario,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar como profesor.El socio solicita el credito para uso personal para comprarse un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Walter Simon continues to work as an elementary school teacher. He already has several years in at this job and it is going well for him. Through this work, the member wants to move forward; his dream is to improve as a teacher. The member requests this loan for personal use, to buy himself a television for his home. He is happy because of the loan and he promises to comply with his payments.

loans.use: to buy himself a television for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy timber, iron roofing, cement, nails, shovels, paint brushes, wheel barrow, electric saw

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebenikoro pelengana sud  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Sebenikoro Pelengana sud. Elles font le petit commerce d’ustensile, de céréale et de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 13éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Maimouna (la femme assise devant dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de l’ustensile de cuisine  dans le quartier de sebenikoro pelengana sud  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 douzaines des ustensiles de cuisine  pour satisfaire la demande de  sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement  féminine.
 Madame Maimouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour la prise en charge d’une partie des dépenses familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Danaya group all live in monogamous families.  On average, they are 43 years old and have five children each.  All of them live in the South Sebenikoro Pelengana neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of the group know one another through ties of neighborhood, family, marriage and also through their income-generating activities in the South Sebenikoro Pelengana neighborhood.  They work in retail, selling kitchen utensils, grains and wood.  In order to grow their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their 13th solidarity loan.

Maimouna, a member of the group, is a well-known seller of kitchen utensils in and around her neighborhood.  In the photo, she is the woman in the front row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy five dozen kitchen utensils to meet her customers' demand.  She sells her goods for cash and also often on credit.  Most of her customers are women. 

Thanks to this loan, Maimouna is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover some of her family's expenses and to increase her business.  Maimouna wants to keep on working in cooperation with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en: Ivapene is a 25 year old single mother with 1 child. She makes and sells ice cake (Ice Pop) in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.Ivapene needs a loan to purchase sacks of sugar,plastic bags and cups,cordial flavor. She plans to save her profits to purchase more ingredients in bulk to improve her business and help her family needs.Ivapene has just joined SPBD in 2014 seeking financial assistance to help with maitaining the establishment of her Ice Pop business.

loans.use: to purcahse paper cups, cordial, sugar

loans.name: Las Activas Del Sector C Group

texts.es: Soledad es madre soltera de dos hijos una de ellas todavía va a la escuela,ella vive con su mamá y su pequeña hija,Soledad a trabajado desde muy chica gracias a su madre que le enseño a salir adelante y defenderse ante las adversidades de la vida.Soledad se dedica hace cuatro años a la venta de productos de limpieza como detergentes, insecticidas, plásticos, lejía y mas.sus principales clientas son sus vecinas y amigas que a podido hacer por su buen trato durante el tiempo que tiene en el negocio, Soledad solicitó el préstamo para surtir su negocio y así poder tener mas clientela,ella lleva mas de cuatro años en el grupo "Las activas del sector C" donde el ambiente es bueno y cordial y agradece a EDAPROSPO por que desde que empezó con el grupo a sabido aprovechar cada préstamo otorgado y a los inversionistas KIVA por el apoyo prestado a pesar de no conocerla.
texts.en: Soledad is a single mother of two children, one of whom is still in school. She lives with her mother and her young daughter. Soledad has worked since she was very young, thanks to her mother who taught her to get ahead and defend herself against the adversities of life. Soledad has worked for four years in the sale of cleaning products like detergents, insecticides, plastics, bleach, and more. Her main clients are her neighbors and friends, which she has been able to make through her good service during her time in this business. Soledad requests the loan to stock her business so she can then have more clientele. For more than four years she has been a member of the group "Las Activas Del Sector C," where the atmosphere is good and friendly. She appreciates EDAPROSPO because, since she began with the group, she has taken full advantage of every loan granted, and she appreciates the Kiva investors for the support given, in spite of not knowing her.

loans.use: to buy products like detergent, air freshener, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Estrellas De Atitlan Group

texts.es:
FRIENDSHIP BRIDGE TRUST BANK “ESTRELLAS DE ATITLAN”
Since its beginning, Friendship Bridge has been involved with the Tz'utuhil women in the traditional indigenous town of Santiago Atitlan, on Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. Even though many of the women never attended school, they have learned how to sustain themselves and support their families with very basic necessities. They realize that a good education is vital to the future of their children and they work very hard to make this a reality.
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Atitlan”, meaning the “Stars of Atitlan”, is made up of women who strive to improve the lives of themselves and their families. The group has been in existence for several years, growing along with Friendship Bridge. Cristina is the current President of the Trust Bank. She is 39 years of age and has two businesses: production of textiles and sale of firewood. Although her business has improved, she wants it to expand even more and has requested a loan which she will use to purchase thread and other supplies for her textile business along with additional firewood to sell.
The “Estrellas de Atitlán” feels empowered by the non-formal educational trainings that they receive each month from a Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge. Some of the topics include budgeting and business management, children and women’s rights, hygiene and nutrition and self esteem. The ladies are anxious to learn and look forward to these informational educational trainings.
On behalf of the group, Cristina thanks all KIVA investors for believing and investing in their dreams. It is through the valuable combination of micro-loans and educational trainings that the ladies are able to realize their dreams and leave poverty behind. This gives them hope for a brighter future for themselves, their families and their town of Santiago Atitlan!
texts.en:
Since its beginning, Friendship Bridge has been involved with the Tz'utuhil women in the traditional indigenous town of Santiago Atitlan, on Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. Even though many of the women never attended school, they have learned how to sustain themselves and support their families with very basic necessities. They realize that a good education is vital to the future of their children, and they work very hard to make this a reality.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Atitlan”, meaning the “Stars of Atitlan”, is made up of women who strive to improve the lives of themselves and their families. The group has been in existence for several years, growing along with Friendship Bridge. 

Cristina is the current President of the Trust Bank. She is 39 years of age and has two businesses: production of textiles and sale of firewood. Although her business has improved, she wants it to expand even more and has requested a loan that she will use to purchase thread and other supplies for her textile business, along with additional firewood to sell.

The “Estrellas de Atitlan” feels empowered by the non-formal educational trainings that they receive each month from a loan officer from Friendship Bridge. Some of the topics include budgeting and business management, children and women’s rights, hygiene and nutrition, and self-esteem. The ladies are anxious to learn and look forward to these informational educational trainings.

On behalf of the group, Cristina thanks all Kiva investors for believing and investing in their dreams. It is through the valuable combination of micro-loans and educational trainings that the ladies are able to realize their dreams and leave poverty behind. This gives them hope for a brighter future for themselves, their families and their town of Santiago Atitlan!

loans.use: to buy thread for improving her production of traditional textiles.

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en: Khaldoun is 19 years old. He lives with his three siblings and his parents. Khaldoun is a university student majoring in Business Administration. He is in his first year, which is the beginning of his study journey. His aim is to support his family by working in his field of study after graduation. His parents aren't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en: Shorouq is a 20-year-old woman who lives with and supports her mother and her siblings now that her father has passed away. She sells home products so that she can make enough money to support herself. She hopes to get a youth loan so that she can expand her business by buying more home products and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy more home products for her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a single mother of two children. Only one child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent.

She has business - a restaurant - and has been in this business for six years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, cassava, beans and beef. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, beans and beef.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Because Hana is a conservative woman, she has asked her husband to take her place in this picture. 

Hana was born in 1964. She has been helping her husband (who appears in the picture) to run their mini market for seven months, in order to support their two sons. They started their business selling only detergents. Then they expanded it by adding food products and candy, and opened another room to split the food products and detergents. Now their mini market is out of food products, so Hana has applied for this loan in order to buy merchandise for her mini market and raise their profits.

loans.use: to merchandise her mini market with food products.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham was born in 1980. He is a married man with no children. Hisham is the only provider for his wife. He has been running his butcher shop for 15 years. Hisham has also been providing his brother, who owns a cafeteria, with the meat he needs. Now he is applying for a loan to buy a meat chopping machine in order to do his work more easily and to raise his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy a meat chopping machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Pablo  Roberto

texts.es: el señor pablo se dedica a su actividad de venta de algodones de azucar y palomitas de maiz  desde hace 8 años, es casado tiene cuatro hijos , de estos dos estudian y se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante en sus estudios,  vende de lunes a domingo, el señor solicita financiamiento para componer otra maquina para abastecer mas mercado y darle un buen mantenimiento a su medio de trabajo que es la motocicleta, con este medio el señor  sale a vender a los demas municipios y entrega pedido de encargos que le hacen,  es un señor muy responsable y luchador su productos que vende es un producto que tiene bastante movimiento ya que los niños les encanta comer los algodones de azucar y palomitas de maiz maximo en esta temporada que se acerca la semana santa  y  el señor pablo  y sus vendedores salen a vender a todas las proseciones de chinandega y municipios.
texts.en: Pablo has worked at his job selling cotton candy and popcorn for eight years. He is married with four children, two of whom are students, and he tries to encourage them in their studies. He sells Monday through Sunday, and requests funding to put together another machine to supply more product, and to keep his mode of transportation in good repair, which is a motorcycle. With this transportation Pablo goes to sell in the surrounding areas and delivers his orders. He is a very responsible and hardworking man. The product he sells is fairly popular since the children love to eat cotton candy and popcorn, especially in this time of year that approaches Holy Week. Pablo and his sellers go out to sell to all of the parade processions in Chinandega and the other cities.

loans.use: to buy a part for his cotton candy maker, and repairs to the motorcycle he uses for going out and delivering orders.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es: la señora julia es comerciante,  desde hace 6 años tiene su negocio de venta de mariscos en el mercadito es madre  de cuatro hijos, solo dos dependen de ella, en su negocio atiende desde las cinco de la mañana que es cuando recibe el pescado fresco hasta las dos y media de la tarde de lunes a sabado, solicita el financiamiento para comprar pescado en cantidad y aprovechar las ventas en la temporada de semana santa que es cuando hay mejor movimiento en el pescado y conchas para los cocteles.
texts.en: Julia is a merchant; for six years she has had a business selling shellfish in the market. She is the mother of four children, only two of whom depend on her. In her business she works from five in the morning when the fresh fish come in until 2:30 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday. She requests funding to buy fish in larger amounts, and to be able to take advantage of sales in the season leading up to Holy Week, which is when there is better sales of fish and conches for cocktails.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, dry fish, and conches.

loans.name: Amanda Nelis

texts.es: Amanda tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos de 20 años, 16 años, 15 años, 10 años y 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y variedad de bebidas. Tiene 5 años de contar con dicho negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Para ella lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar mejores condiciones de vida. Amanda desea construir una pila con baño dado que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para almacenar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y para pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Amanda is 41 years old and lives in a home of her own with her five children, ages 20, 16, 15, 10, and 3.  She sells beauty products and a variety of beverages and has been working this business for five years.  She has lots of experience and customers who prefer to buy from her more each day.  The most important thing to her is her children and does everything within her reach to provide them with better living conditions.  Amanda wants to build a storage tanks because she doesn’t have a place to store water, so she is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to build a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, drinks, bread, toothpaste, and rice.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 56 años, es una mujer viuda y madre de 6 hijos,  habita en la linda y heroica  ciudad de Cartagena donde tiene una tienda desde hace 20 años, en la cual vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar. Su  negocio partió de un sueño, desde muy niña cuando jugaba a vender en una tienda con sus amigos de infancia. Ella tiene su casa acondicionada como un local y en su primer cuarto, a través de una ventana atiende a su clientela. Todos los días abre su negocio  desde las  7 de la mañana y solo hasta las 10  de la noche lo cierra para descansar. Ella tiene el mismo proveedor de las tiendas cercanas que trae a su negocio los pedidos que hace día a día, semana a semana de acuerdo con la necesidad que genera la rotación de sus artículos. En la actualidad está aplicando  a  un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará aceite, productos de aseo y en general artículos de primera necesidad. Con esta inversión su estantería estará mejor surtida y logrará abastecer las necesidades de su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva una muy buena inversión.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and a widow with six children.  She lives in the beautiful and heroic city of Cartagena where she has had a store for 20 years and she sells snacks, food, beverages, and pantry items.  Her business came from a dream from when she was a child and used to play store with her childhood friends.  She has her home set up as a store and serves customers through a window.  She opens her store at 7:00 am every morning and stays open until 10:00 pm.  She has the same supplier as the nearby stores, who delivers her daily and weekly orders to replenish her stock.  She is asking for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy cooking oil, toiletries, and general primary needs products.  Her shelves will be better stocked with the help of this loan and she will be able to make good use of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Emanuel De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Emanuel de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está conformado por Rosa Amalia, ella tiene 36 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de Zapatos y ropa para dama, en su local ubicado en Santo Tomas, desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de zapatos para dama, y caballero así como compra de blusas y pantalones para dama, su deseo es  surtir mas su zapatería, y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dúo Emanuel de Santo Tomas

This duo includes Rosa Amalia.  She is 36 years old and sells shoes and women’s clothing from her shop in Santo Tomas.  She’s done this for several years and is asking for this loan to buy ladies’ and men’s shoes, blouses, and ladies’ pants.  She wants to stock her shoe store and satisfy her customer needs.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, pepper, and fufu.

loans.name: Hurma

texts.en:
Hurma is requesting another loan in the amount of 200,000 ALL to do some more work in their family home. 

With the previous loan, she did plenty of work, but she's not done yet and needs your financial support again.

loans.use: to finish building her family home.

loans.name: Zegjine

texts.en:
Zegjine is trying to expand her business. This time she is requesting another loan which is larger than the previous ones. 

So far, she's been doing well, and she has been able to pay the monthly installments on time and in full. 

Zegjine is very grateful to lenders that with their kindness they bring so much goodness to people in need like her.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of used items such as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Productivas Group

texts.es:
María (primera de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es la líder del grupo Mujeres Productivas; es una señora  de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene 7 hijos,  ellos viven en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace 10 años; se dedica a esta labor porque no cuenta con preparación académica para ejercer una profesión; sin embargo ha adquirido habilidad para llevar a cabo esta actividad. La venta de su producto la lleva a cabo en el mercado local de su comunidad. Ella realiza esto porque es el medio que le genera ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia.
María es visionaria y por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de más cortes y blusas para vender más e incrementar sus ingresos.
Sueña con ampliar la cobertura geográfica de su venta y asi  hacer crecer su negocio y con ello tener los recursos suficientes para brindarles educación a sus hijos para afrontar el futuro de una mejor manera.
Ella se ha organizado en grupo porque le gusta trabajar en equipo, y porque muchas de las integrantes de su grupo son sus amigas.
texts.en: María (first from the left to right in the photograph) is the leader of the group "Mujeres Productivas" ("Productive Women"); she is a 43-year-old woman, single, with 7 children. They live in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá. She has worked in buying and selling traditional clothing for ten years. She does this job because she does not have educational training to be a professional. However, she has acquired the ability to carry out this activity. She sells her product in her community's local market. She does this because it is how she generates income that she uses to support her family. María is visionary and that is why she requests a loan to buy more skirts and blouses to sell and increase her earnings. She dreams of increasing the geographic area she can cover with her sales, and that way she can grow her business and with it have sufficient resources to offer education to her children so they can face the future in a better way. She has organized the group because she likes to work as a team, and because many of the members of the group are her friends.

loans.use: to buy more skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 6 hijos y vive en Morazan, Yoro. Doña María es muy trabajadora, anteriormente generaba ingresos haciendo trabajos de costura, luego quería obtener mayores ingresos y hace 6 años que decidió establecer un negocio de comidas. Ella elabora y vende comidas típicas y refrescos, pero su mayor demanda está en las baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, huevo, queso, crema y otros), estas baleadas las vende para el desayuno y cena. El negocio lo tiene en un puesto de venta comercial. 
Ella ha obtenido varios créditos con ODEF y esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado. El préstamo actual es por 5,000 Lempiras que solicita para comprar insumos como harina de trigo, manteca, huevos, frijoles, quesos etc. para elaborar baleadas y otras comidas para vender. Su meta es mantener siempre su negocio activo para generar ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old, a widow, and has six children.  She lives in Morazan, Yoro.  Maria is very hardworking and used to do sewing work, but then wanted to increase her income and decided to set up a food business.  She makes typical food and refreshments but her greatest requests are for baleadas (flour tortillas filled with beans, eggs, cheese, cream, etc.).  She sells these baleadas for breakfast and dinner.  Her dream is to have a commercial location.

She has gotten several loans through ODEF and is grateful for the support.  She will use the 5,000 Lempiras to buy supplies, such as flour, lard, eggs, beans, cheeses, etc. to make baleadas and other foods.  Her goal is to always keep her business active to generate income and support her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, pig's feet, and spare ribs for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, oil, maggi cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, plantain, and coal for her business.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es: Elsa tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y responsable. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones  habitacionales de su familia para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la cocina y para encementar el piso de la vivienda el cual es de tierra. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Elsa is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions, for which she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof of her kitchen and to lay a cement floor to replace the dirt floor in her home. With the requested loan, she will buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use:
to buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof of her kitchen and lay a cement floor in her home

cocina y encementar el piso de la vivienda.

loans.name: Laura Gisela

texts.es:
Laura Gisela nació en la cuidad de Bogotá, los padres José y Sandra la abuela mercedes madre de Sandra estaba también conmocionada con la nueva llegada del bebe. 

Con el pasar de los tiempos la pequeña bebe fue creciendo y aprendió a dar los primeros pasos sin la compañía del padre; pues el siempre se encontraba trabajando y lejos de la cuidad. 

De la mano de la madre, la abuela y demás familia fue forjando valores y principios que años después harían de ella una persona de bien y que le colabora a la sociedad. 

El deporte favorito de Laura siempre ha sido el fútbol, siempre ha sido unas de las pasiones y porque no decirlo una de las debilidades. 
Conoció grandes amigos que le enseñaron  muchas cosas, entre ellas a cómo luchar  y a no sentirse sola, pues con los años la soledad trajo recuerdos tristes del padre con el que no compartía tiempo, la madre se enamoro y años después formalizaron un hogar. Laura tenia la llegada de un hermanito, 
Cuando nació Esteban, Laura prometió cuidarlo y dedicarse  completamente a lo que sería la nueva familia sin dejar a un lado los estudios y la pasión por el fútbol. 


Esteban a punto de culminar primaria y Laura ya estaba acabando bachillerato 
y pronto juntos tenían que cuidar del pequeño Brandon el siguiente de los hermanos  y las  travesuras. Juntos le enseñaron a jugar fútbol  y hacer muchos goles con un balón de caucho, muy  pronto otra hermanita llegaría a hacer parte de la familia. 

Laura pronto se vio envuelta en una dura decisión que tenía que afrontar sola, si la vida tenía un propósito o si solo estaba para hacer cumplir propósitos,  
pronto se dio cuenta que tenía grandes dones para hacer brillar como el sol. 

La carrera que había escogido para ser una profesional no solo de nombre o de titulo si no de principios seria administración de empresas 
pero la familia no contaba con tantos fondos para financiar una carrera tan costosa y tan larga 
así que la pequeña Laura para coger terreno entro a trabajar en una estética y una peluquería  como auxiliar  

En este trabajo aprendió cosas muy importantes, con base en eso 
decidió entrar a estudiar estética para poder financiar la carrera de los sueños y poder ayudar a los hermanos. 
El convenio con kiva seria una ayuda grande para ella ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder cancelar la mensualidad completa, ya que el trabajo que tiene no le alcanza para poder pagar todos los gastos que ella tiene  y a demás esta ahorrando una parte de dinero para poder pagar la carrera que ella quiere estudiar más adelante.
texts.en:
Laura Gisela was born in the city of Bogota; her parents José and Sandra and her grandmother Mercedes (Sandra's mother) were all excited about the arrival of the baby. With the passage of time, the small child grew and learned to take her first steps without her father's help, since he was always working and far from the city. 

Holding hands with her mother, grandmother and other family members, she established values and principles that, years later, made her into a good person who is collaborative with society. 

Laura's favorite sport has always been soccer, it has always been one of her passions and one of her weaknesses. She made many great friends who taught her many things, like how to fight and not feel alone, as with time her solitude brought sad memories of her father, with whom she didn't spend very much time. Her mother fell in love, and later founded new a home, and Laura's baby brother was born. When Esteban was born, Laura promised to take care of him and dedicate herself 100% to her new family, without de-prioritizing her studies or her passion for soccer.

When Esteban was on the very of finishing grade school and Laura was finishing high school, together they had to care for little Brandon, the next in the line of siblings and mischief. Together, they taught him to play soccer and score many goals with a rubber ball, and soon another little sister was born into the family. 

Laura was soon alone and faced with a difficult decision: whether life has purpose or whether it solely exists to fulfill certain purposes, and soon she realized that she had a great ability to shine like the sun. 

The professional career path she chose for herself, based not just on a name or a title but also on her principles, is business administration. However, her family didn't have the money to pay for such a long and expensive career, so Laura instead chose to work at a beauty/hair salon as an assistant. 

Through that job, she learned very important things, and from those learnings she decided to study aesthetics so that she could pay for the career of her dreams and help her siblings. 

The Kiva partnership will be of great help to her, as she doesn't have the economic resources to pay her full tuition upfront since her work doesn't earn her enough to pay for all of her expenses. She is also saving up some money to be able to pay for the career she wants to study in the future.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Horonya vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebenikoro pelengana  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de sebenikoro Pelegana sud. Elles font le petit commerce, de tubercule, d’ustensile de cuisine  et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 13éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hidou (1ére  femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pomme de terre dans le quartier Sebenikoro Pelengana  sud et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de pomme de terre pour satisfaire la demande de  sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Hidou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour la prise en charge d’une partie des dépenses familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women in the Horonya group all live in monogamous families. They average 46 years of age with four children, and all live in the Sébénikoro Pelengana neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the South Sébénikoro Pelegana district. They are retail traders of tubers, kitchen utensils and grain cereals. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 13th group loan cycle.

Mrs. Hidou (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a great potato vendor in the South Sébénikoro Pelegana neighborhood and its surrounding area. She intends to use her loan to buy five bags of potatoes to meet the demand of her customers. Sales are for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Hidou hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs. This loan will be used to support some of the family expenses and increase her stock-in-trade.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una señora casada de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su hija de diez años de edad y viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. Ella se encuentra en el centro de la fotografía.
Doña Manuela es una mujer emprendedora, ya que su mayor deseo es ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Ella comenta que actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de diferentes clases. Esta actividad es bastante productiva y rentable, porque las mujeres de su región lo utilizan y es por ello que existe una fuerte demanda. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. Como también comenta que es enfermera en su comunidad.
Ahora ella ha tomado la iniciativa de formar un grupo, con el objetivo de mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo y a su vez dar a conocer el arte que se plasma en estos bordados. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de materiales con que se elaboran estas prendas típicas.
El sueño de doña Manuela es exportar su producto a otros países, con el fin de asegurar el bienestar de su familia para que en un futuro ellos tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is a married, 33-year-old woman who lives with her 10-year-old daughter in the Department of Suchitepequez. She is in the center of the photograph. 

Doña Manuela is a very enterprising woman, because her greatest desire is to help her family get ahead. She currently works sewing different kinds of traditional clothing. This is a fairly productive and profitable activity, because the women of her region wear traditional clothing and therefore demand is strong. Through her work, she earns acceptable income and profits that help her cover her family's expenses. She also works as a nurse in her community.

Now she has taken the initiative to forma a group, with the goal of improving the economic status of the group members' families while at the same time putting on display the art in their embroidery. This loan will be used to buy materials to make these traditional clothing items. 

Doña Manuela's dream is to export her products to other countries, with the end goal of guaranteeing her family's well-being so that they can have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to sew traditional clothing

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 49 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Remedios has a store that sells goods and dry goods. She had this business for a year. She requested a loan for additional capital for her store.

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods to sell.

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Om- Manal Group

texts.en:
Om- Manal is a group consisting of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Saud is a 30-year-old single woman living with her family in miserable conditions. She is the leader of the group. Saud studied only through elementary school because she couldn't complete her studies. She is very active and works very hard to help her family with their expenses. Saud started her business six years ago. She sells food in the street for the children and the people in her area. From this business, Saud earns good profits, but it is barely enough to cover all the family's expenses. She doesn't have enough money to meet all the demands of her customers, so she applied for the loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of goods such as flour, sugar, potatoes, cheese, and other goods.

Saud looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small shop in her area and providing her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as flour, sugar, potatoes, and cheese for the food stall

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old, married with two adult-aged children. She is from Balasdiot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She has had a sari-sari store business for 3 years now. She joined Paglaum in 2009 and took other loans already.  

Recently, she applied to Paglaum for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and laundry soap. The profit she earns in her business will be used for savings retirement.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and laundry soap.

loans.name: Xejuyu Vasconcelos Group

texts.en:
In the highlands of Guatemala, there is a town called Vasconselos that is populated by indigenous Maya “Kaqchiquel”. The men mainly work in the fields cultivating corn and the women create beautiful traditional textiles. Specifically, the textiles are made in the “ikat”or “jaspe” manner when the yarn is resist dyed. Hanks of yarn are tightly tied and then dipped into dye. The tied portions resist the dye. Once the yarn is dried, weavers, like the ones in Vasconselos, make it into cloth with various designs incorporated into it. The cloth is then transformed into elaborate blouses and skirts that are representative of the area.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Xejuyú” is located in Vasconcelos. Five of the seven members of the Trust Bank work in producing textiles. They are requesting a new loan in order to introduce new designs, be more competitive and increase production. Matea is a 40 year old member of the Trust Bank. She is the hard-working mother of six children and tries her very best to meet their needs. Because she is recently separated from her husband, Matea has to work two jobs to support her children. She has requested a loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase additional thread, dye and paraffin in hopes of increasing her business. Matea sets a good example by her strong work ethic and perseverance. She looks happily looks forward to the next chapter of her life, realizing positive changes and being able to move forward.

Like the other clients in Friendship Bridge, Matea has high hopes for her children. She realizes that education is a key to a successful future. Her biggest dream is that she will be able to watch her six year old son complete his education. Her other children were not able to go to school because they had to work to support their big family. Matea looks forward to the monthly educational trainings that the Friendship Bridge Loan Officer presents on topics like effective business administration and budgeting, nutrition and health, as well as women’s rights and self esteem. Other relevant topics are covered as well and the information is of great use to Matea and the ladies. All realize that education is essential for them to improve conditions in their lives and move ahead!

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Xejuyú” appreciates the kindness and generosity of Kiva investors. The women are committed to working hard to repay the loans. They are committed to achieving success in their businesses and empowering themselves. They will create a more prosperous and successful life for themselves, their families and their community of Vasconcelos!

loans.use: To buy materials to make textiles.

loans.name: Santa Cecilia Group

texts.en:
In the Guatemalan highlands, there is a rural town called “Quiche” and it is here that twelve women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Santa Cecilia”. Their average age is 36 years and the ladies work in textile production. They are talented artisans creating beautiful embroidered and woven textiles.

Cecilia is a 34-year-old member of the Trust Bank who attended elementary school for two years. Cecilia is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge for the first time as she needs working capital. She will invest the funds in the purchase of yarns, dyes and other materials that she will use to create typical skirts called “cortes”. A corte is the traditional Mayan women's tube skirt that can be anywhere from three to six yards in length, usually woven on a treadle loom. Along with an ornate blouse called a “huipil”, the “corte” along with a belt called a “faja” are universal elements of each women’s traditional outfit or “traje”. Each village in Guatemala has its own specific style, color, and design of “traje”. Cecelia works with her husband and they generate enough income creating “cortes” to support their family. It is especially important to them that their children are enrolled in elementary school.

The ladies of the “Santa Cecilia” Trust Bank share a common goal which is to increase their income by expanding their businesses and improve their quality of life. Besides having access to loans, they receive educational trainings during their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. It is the combination of the loans and educational trainings that comprises the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus Program. During their meeting this past month, the training was about leadership and women’s identity. The women learned how to identify the characteristics of a good leader and how each of them can develop their own leadership skills. 

Examples of other topics include health, medicinal plants and nutrition, effective business management, budgeting and indebtedness as well as self-esteem.

loans.use: To buy yarns, dyes, and other materials to make typical skirts.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 24-year-old married mother of one child, who has been working as a tutor from her house since three years ago.
Iman is a hard worker who provides education to her neighbors and relatives who need special additional care and support. Her business is located at home, since at the meantime she isn't financially capable of establishing her own educational center, and she is still taking good care of her baby.
Iman is well known in her region with her good reputation and special talents in her domain, that's why she has to work hard to develop this business properly.
Today, Iman is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary household appliances for her house, in addition to a special advanced laptop that can help her in developing her teaching skills, and be the first step forward towards establishing her specialized tutoring center.
She hopes that one day her dream will come true.

loans.use: To buy necessary household appliances for her house, in addition to a special advanced laptop that can help her in developing her teaching skills, and be the first step forward towards establishing her specialized tutoring center

loans.name: Richel Mae

texts.en:
Richel Mae is single without children. Richel Mae is 33 years old and lives in Mialen,Clarin, Philippines.

Richel Mae is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

Richel Mae has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Richel Mae hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, frijoles beans, sugar, candies and detergent for her store.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es: José tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su  madre y sus dos hermanos de 12 años y 7 años de edad. José se gana la vida mediante la compra y venta de pescado el cual comercializa en las principales zonas de su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo. Es un joven emprendedor y responsable quien desea apoyar a su familia con la economía del hogar. Su negocio de venta de pescado es muy importante ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de pescado y además también desea comprar variedad de fruta para poner a la venta y poder así abarcar un mercado más grande que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 20, lives with his mother and two sisters, aged 12 and 7, in their own house.  He earns a living by buying and selling fish.  He has been selling his product in the main areas of his town for a long time.  He is a business-minded and responsible young man who wants to support his family and contribute to the household expenses.  

His fish selling business is very important as it is his only source of income.  He has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of fish and also to buy a selection of fruit which will help him to break into a bigger market.  This will help him to earn more and improve the standard of living of all his family.

loans.use: to buy fish and a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana works as a sempstress. She's been at this job for two years. Svetlana lives in a small house with her husband and one son. They would like to improve their living conditions. 

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase a new sofa. She hopes to pay the loan back and continue making improvements in her house.

loans.use: to purchase a new sofa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Velene

texts.en: Velene is 45 years old. She is married with six children aged between two and 23. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sle such as beans and sorghum .

loans.name: Zakah Group

texts.en:
Zakah is a group consists of six women, living in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB.

Foziyah is a 34-year-old single woman who lives with her family in Taiz, Yemen. She studied till secondary school. She wasn't able to complete her studies because the condition of her family was very bad. Foziyah doesn't have any job or business, but she works hard in order to improve the living conditions of her family. That is why she decided to purchase new home appliances such as a tallboy, cooking pots, steel cups, glasses cups etc., but she doesn't have a lot of money for that. Therefore, she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new appliances. 

Foziyah looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB. Also she hopes to improve her family's situation so they have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase new appliances for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, bananas and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Marie Console

texts.en: Marie Console is 38 years old. She sells art crafts and has been in the business for the past five years. She has requested the loan to buy more art crafts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to refurbish the house.

loans.use: To buy more artcrafts for sale.

loans.name: Thiedo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village a été créé le 22 Avril  2007,  il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 12 cycles actuellement. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

Madame Thièdo (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits de consommation courante sucre, thé, assaisonnement et divers autres produits alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle achètera un sac de sucre, une grosse de thé et quels que paquets de bouillons pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan association was created April 22, 2007. It comprises women who share very strong solidarity links because of their companionship over the past five years, that is currently 12 loan cycles.

The members wish to develop income-generating activities to improve their living conditions and facilitate access to basic food products. These women's main activity is small retail business, and they also grow crops in the rainy season.

Mrs. Thièdo (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has five children, three girls and two boys. Her business is to sell basic consumer goods: sugar, tea, seasonings and various other food products.

With the new loan she will buy a bag of sugar, a gross of tea and a few packages of  bouillon cubes for retail sales.

Profits will enable her to support her husband in managing family needs.

loans.use: buy a bag of sugar, a gross of tea and a few packages of  bouillon cubes for retail sales.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 29-year-old married Syrian citizen, mother of one child, who has eleven years of experience in the clothes selling domain. 
Dima is a hard worker who is putting so much effort to develop her family's living and improve their socioeconomic situation.
Today, Dima is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to her home's kitchen to keep it a healthy living place and will try to start her own small business at home to increase her financial support to her beloved family.
Her long experience in this domain, provides her with special skills and talents that can help her in establishing and developing her own business properly.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to her home's kitchen to keep it a healthy living place and will try to start her own small business at home to increase her financial support to her beloved family

loans.name: Ismahila

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Ismahila est âgé  de 40 ans, marié et père d’un  enfant. Il vit chez son feu  père dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier  Bagadadji de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 9éme année fondamentale (système éducatif  Malien), il commença à apprendre le métier de meunier  auprès de son ami. Après  des années d’apprentissage à coté de ce dernier, il évolua seul pour exercer la même activité depuis 5 ans, il jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Il  sollicite ce prêt dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. Il est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans. Après 2  prêts individuels  tous correctement remboursés, il est à son 3éme  prêt qu’  il compte utiliser  pour acheter  un compteur électrique.  
Monsieur Ismahila  fait ses prestations  au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle  mixte. Il envisage de réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de pérenniser et diversifiée son activité.
texts.en:
Ismahila is 40 years old, married and has one child.  He lives in his late father's house, in a traditional family in the Bagadadji area of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He left school in the ninth year (Mali education system), and started training as a miller with a friend.  After several years of apprenticeship with his friend, Ismahila has now been working for five years on his own.
