He has requested this loan in order to boost his working capital and respond to the demands of his customers.  He has been working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for two years.  This will be his third loan, the previous two loans were fully and correctly repaid.  Ismahila will use his loan to buy an electricity meter.  He sells his services to various customers on a cash or credit basis.

Ismahila expects to earn 80,000 francs CFA a month which will enable him to provide for the expenses of his family and improve his working capital.

In the future, Ismahila would like to ensure that his business continues to operate and diversify it.

loans.use: to buy an electricity meter for his business.

loans.name: Edita Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bankito Rio Bravo.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita,  tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tienen tres hijos de  11, 5 y  1 año, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo fabrica labrillos.
Doña Edita es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para trasladarlos hasta las ciudades cercanas donde son utilizados, ella por su parte desde su hogar se gana algo por su cuenta, vende helados, colas, aguas, jugos entre otras cosas con lo cual se gana algo y contribuye más que todo con gastos relacionados a los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar  madera y  tierra para elaborar los ladrillos, helados y colas para su negocio. Está casi desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group ‘Bankito Rio Bravo’ meets every 15 days in Rio Bravo, Montecristi.  This city is well-known for its wide range of local products such as its toquilla straw hats, which are famous both at home and abroad.

This is where Edita, 34, lives.  She is married and has three children aged 11, 5 and 1.  The two older children are studying at school.  Her husband makes bricks.

Edita is a good wife who is asking for this loan so her husband can use it in his line of work.  He makes bricks for building and sells to traders who buy off him and then transport the bricks to wherever they are needed in neighboring areas.  Edita earns a small income herself, by selling frozen treats, Cola, water, juice and other things from home.  This allows her to earn some money which she can put towards her children’s education.

This loan is to buy wood and earth to make bricks and to buy frozen goods and Cola for her business.  She has been with the credit group since just after it was founded and she is grateful for the help she receives.  Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to buy wood and earth for making bricks and frozen desserts and Cola.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village a été créé le 22 Avril  2007,  il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 12 cycles actuellement. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de huit  enfants dont quatre garçons et quatre filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de mie. Elle achète les russes de miel au prés des producteurs fait le pression pour l’extraire le miel en vu de la vente par litre.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter une quantité considérable de russe pour la pression et la vente.

Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan association was created April 22, 2007. It comprises women who share very strong solidarity links because of their companionship over the past five years, which amounts to 12 loan cycles.

The members wish to develop income-generating activities to improve their living conditions and facilitate access to basic food products. These women's main activity is small retail business, and they also grow crops in the rainy season.

Mrs. Mariama (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of eight children, four boys and four girls. Her business is the sale of honey. She buys honeycombs from the producers and presses them to extract the honey for sales by liter.

With this new loan she intends to buy a large quantity of honeycombs for pressing and sales.

The profits generated by this activity will enable her to increase her savings and support her husband in managing family needs.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of honeycombs for pressing and sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria nació y vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo. Esta ciudad se característica por tener paisajes hermosos y ser la ciudad folclórica del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. En el mes de Julio se celebra la festividad de la Virgen de Carmen y llegan de diferentes lugares del Perú para esta fiesta que se extiende por tres días. Maria durante todo el año se dedica a la venta de verduras y agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos, ella es una de los fundadoras del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” y tiene varios años participando. En esta ciudad no existe entidad financieras permanentes como la Asociación Arariwa entonces ella se presta dinero desde hace varios años atrás entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, alberjitas,habas, papa, tomates y otras más. Maria está agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria was born and lives in Paucartambo in the region of Cusco.  This city is well-known for its beautiful landscapes and its traditional customs.  Most of the people work in agriculture, livestock and raising animals.  In July they celebrate the festival of the ‘Virgin del Carmen’ and people from all over Peru visit the city to join in the celebrations which last over three days.

Maria works all year growing and selling vegetables as she has various plots of land at her disposal.  She was one of the founding members of the credit group ‘Nuevo Amanecer’ which has been in existence for several years.  In this city, there are no financial entities so she has been asking for loans for several years through the organization ‘Asociacion Arariwa’.  

She will use this loan to buy vegetables such as carrots, onions, peas, beans, potatoes, tomatoes and others.  She is very grateful for the help she receives and promises to pay off her installments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, onions, peas, beans, potatoes, tomatoes and more.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 27 years old single lady from Gaza city. she works as a teacher in the public schools where she gets a low income. Amani wanted to improve herself and open a small project two years ago, which is an education center for school students. she provides advanced for remedial lessons for the weak students with help from other teachers.
Amani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new furniture like chairs and desks for the students. by taking this loan, amani will be able to improve her education center and increase its capacity

loans.use: to buy new furniture like chairs and desks for the students.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en: Assumpta is 40 years old. She is married with three children. She sells drinks both alcohol and non-alcoholic. She has spent one year in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more drinks for sale. She plans to use the profits for opening up another retail business of foodstuffs in the near future.

loans.use: To buy both alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man, who has been working as a car mechanic since ten years ago. Ali started working early since he had to quit school and support his parents in their living.
Ali is employed in a car mechanic shop, and he is working hard to develop himself and start his own business.
Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tools to take his first step forward towards establishing his own business, and to buy necessary curtains to his house.
This is Ali's second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, through his previous loan he was capable of completing building his own house which he is working hard to develop and make it his dream home.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools to take his first step forward towards establishing his own business, and to buy necessary curtains to his house

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is a 41 years old married woman from Gaza city. She is a mother for one son and one daughter. she works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low income. Naheel wants to improve the family home and buy all the needed stuff.
Naheel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy water purification machine for her home. by taking this loan, Naheel will be able to provide her family a pure water especialy for her kids.
Naheel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Arbat village. She is divorced woman who is involved in land cultivation. She owns a plot of land where potato is cultivated. Besides agriculture Ruzanna also is involved in sewing and receives orders from locals.  
Ruzanna has now applied for this loan to be able to enlarge her farming business and gather more income for living. 
The requested loan of USD 1000 will be a huge support for Ruzanna to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and medicine for disease of the land. This is Ruzanna's second loan. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her financial stability is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Ruzanna has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and medicine for disease

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 25 years old. She is a mother of two. Her husband works as a house builder. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs for resale, such as beans and maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar né vers 1966 à Touléassou, il est marié, père de 3 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Lafiabougou un quartier populaire de la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Il  mène des activités d’achat et de vente des pommes de terre et des patates il ya plus de 7 ans, il s'approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
 Il est à son premier prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de pommes de terre de 50 kg et 20 paniers de patate. Sa vente se fait dans une place fixe au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 195 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1966 in Touléassou.  He is married, has three children and lives with his family in Lafiabougou, a busy area of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He has been buying and selling potatoes and sweet potatoes for more than seven years.  He buys his supplies from the area around Sikasso.

This will be Oumar's first individual loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.   He wants the loan in order to be able to respond to the ever-increasing demands of his customers.  He will use the loan to buy twenty 50kg sacks of potatoes and twenty baskets of sweet potatoes.  Oumar sells his produce from a fixed site at the market, to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Oumar expects to earn a monthly average of 195,000 francs CFA, which will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama est né en Décembre 1952 à Sikasso, il est marié, père de 4 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Nankoun-diassa un village  tout près de la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Il  mène des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des légumes  il ya plus de 20 ans, il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso dont il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clientèle.
 Il est à son troisième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 15 sacs de 100 kg de céréales et une quantité importante de légumes. Sa vente se fait dans une place fixe à Nankou-diassa à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Adama was born in December 1952, in Sikasso.  He is married, has four children and lives with his family in Nankoun-diassa, a village near the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He has been buying and selling cereals and vegetables for more than 20 years.  He buys his supplies from the area surrounding Sikasso and is very popular with his customers.

This will be his third individual loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  He will use his loan to buy fifteen 100kg sacks of cereals and a large quantity of vegetables, which he hopes will satisfy the ever-increasing demands of his customers.  Adama sells his produce from a fixed site in Nankou-diassa, to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Adama expects to earn a monthly average of 120,000 francs CFA, which will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 32-year-old married father of one child, who has been working as a blacksmith since fourteen years ago. Rabih is a Palestinian refugee who puts so much effort on developing his family's socioeconomic situation, that's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary requested iron pillars to develop his business and reply for his customers increasing needs and requests.
Rabih is well known in his region with his good reputation and special talent in his domain with competitive prices he sets.
He hopes to keep on developing his business in a well managed way to make sure that he can reply to his beloved family's needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary requested iron pillars to develop his business and reply for his customers increasing needs and requests

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Donatha is 48 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have both nine children. All of them go to school. She sells soft drinks and beers for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Muringaniro Group

texts.fr:
Salvator fait partie du groupe Muringaniro et habite à Bujumbura.Il est marié à Anick une cultivatrice.

Il a sous sa charge ses 2 sœurs qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de pagnes depuis  2 ans. 

Il  est  à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de pagnes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une maison.
texts.en:
Salvator is part of the Muringaniro group and lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Anick, a crop farmer.

His two sisters attend school and are under his care.

He has been trading pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for the past two years. 

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy lots of pagnes for resale, to earn more.

In years to come, he would like to build a house.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy lots of pagnes for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Shahrazad

texts.en: Shahrazad was born in 1977. She is a mother of 4 all living in a renrted house in Karak/Jordan. Her husband is a retired man. Shahrazad has been working in the goat- and sheep-sales for almost 3 years now. Now she decided to buy more goats and raise her productivity in order to raise her sales. so she has applied for this loan to do so.

loans.use: To buy more goats to raise her productivity

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bréhima est né en Avril 1974 à Sikasso, il est marié, père de 4 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Ouayerma II un quartier populaire de la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises de boutique( sucre, bonbon, thé,huile,lait plus divers marchandises de la boutique) il ya 3 ans, il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
 Il est à son premier prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 sacs de 50 kg de sucre, 10 cartons du thé, 20 sachets de 12 paquets de bonbon, 2 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 10 cartons de lait en poudre  et plus divers marchandises de la boutique. Sa vente se fait dans sa boutique à Ouayerma I à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bréhima was born in April 1974, in Sikasso.  He is married, has four children and lives with his family in Ouayerma II, a busy area of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He has been buying and selling products in his shop (sugar, sweets, tea, oil, milk, etc) for three years.  He buys his stock at the main market in Sikasso.

This will be Bréhima's first individual loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  He will use the loan to buy two 50kg sacks of sugar, ten boxes of tea, twenty boxes of a dozen packets of sweets, two drums of oil, ten boxes of powdered milk and various other items for his shop.  He hopes this will allow him to satisfy the ever-increasing demands of his customers.  Bréhima's shop is in the Ouayerma I district and he sells to men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Bréhima expects to earn a monthly average of 55,000 francs CFA, which will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help John purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Nsamo Mixed School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Hassan. He is the Head teacher of Nsamo Mixed Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Seeta in Mukono district with 600 students. Nsamo Mixed Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra filtration water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra Filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nsamo Mixed Primary will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Hassan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: St. Kizito School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ezekiel. He is the Head teacher of St. Kizito High School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo in Wakiso district with 650 students. St. Kizito High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Kizito High will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Ezekiel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est cultivateur d'onions établi dans le village de mbane, il est marié et père de 8 enfants, son âge s'élève à 42 ans, il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage depuis son enfance accompagné de ses parents, avec ce prêt, il se procurer du semence d'onions, d'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il envisage à l'avenir d'accroître sa production en quantité et en qualité afin de pouvoir toucher d'autres clients venants d'horizons divers.
texts.en:
Moussa grows onions in the village of Mbane.  He is 42 years old, married and has eight children.  He has been working in agriculture, with his family, since childhood.

Moussa will use his loan to buy onion seed, weed killer and fertilizer.

In the future, he would like to increase his production levels and improve the quality of his produce.  He hopes this would enable him to attract new customers from different areas.

loans.use: to buy onion seed, weed killer and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bright Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Adinani. He is the Director of Studies at Bright Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of in Wakiso town with 500 students. Bright Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a conservative lady. So she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Amal was born in 1970. She is a mother of 8 all living in Baqaa/Jordan. Her husband is a retired man. Amal has been working in the goat- and sheep-sales for almost 3 years now. Now she decided to buy more goats and raise her productivity in order to raise her sales. so she has applied for this loan to do s

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep for her business

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 51 years old widow woman from Gaza city. She is a mother for two sons and two daughters. now the live on her dead husband's salary and this is the only source of income to the family. Her two sons are students university, they would like to take the BA degree and find jobs to improve the family living conditions. 
Afaf took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her two sons for their studies. by taking this loan, they will be able to do their home works and write the reports easily. 
Afaf appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her two sons for their studies.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar was born in 1970. He is married and a father of 4. Omar started his own independent business by renting a small store and turning it into a small café where he serves  hot drinks since two years. He wants to serve more types of hot drinks other than tea and coffee in addition to ice cream in order to attract more customers and raise his sales. For that he applied for this loan to buy them and an ice cream machine.

loans.use: To buy an ice cream machine and more hot drinks to serve

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a buy and sell coconut wine  business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional galloon of coconut wine to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for  years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional galloon of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en: Waleed was born in 1982. He is married and has 2 children. Waleed is the only provider for his family. He has his own business of selling mobile phones and their accessories at his store. Waleed is applying for a loan to purchase more mobile phones and their accessories to sell in order to raise his profit and be able to cover his children needs.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and their accessories to sell

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala, who is 51 years old married woman, lives in village Zemo Erketi. She has son and daughter-in-law, who is a housekeeper. Makvala works as a nurse and monthly generates 250 GEL. Also she and her son run agricultural activity. Particularly they engaged in cultivating plot of agricultural land, harvesting nuts and maize and use the products for local trading. In order to meet all daily expenses more effectively and make better style of living for her family, Makvala requested a loan. Her request was approved with the start up program, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will use loan for purchasing milked-cow, produce milk products and sell it locally in a good price. This is the profitable business in this area and Makvala will be able to generate significant income and for future enlarge her dairy farming also. She awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase milked-cow

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 55 years old and widow with five children.  With  children in school, Benedicta works very hard to provide for them.

Benedicta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Benedicta has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as . 

In the future Benedicta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina lives with her brother. She is involved in beekeeping and currently keeps 85 colonies of bees. Alina sells the gathered honey in nearby communities and sustains her family's living. Now, willing to improve her agribusiness Alina has applied for this loan. The loan of USD 2100 will help her to purchase 22 colonies of bees and enlarge the production of honey. As this is Alina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history

loans.use: to pay for 22 colonies of bees

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 34 years old and with three children, two of whom in school, Jenifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jenifer's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jenifer is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Jenifer has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Jenifer is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and has eight children and she works hard to help her husband to generate additional to her family.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her business.

Erlinda has been farming vegetable for  years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Doña Damaris es originaria de Granada, casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 39 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio trabajando con su esposo en una panadería, pero al ver que llegaba mucha clientela a comprar pan decidió implementar una pulpería con diversos productos que les ofrecía a los clientes que llegaban a la panadería. Su meta próxima es incrementar las ventas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Gaseosa entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mantener productos disponibles para su clientela y así lograra obtener mejores ingresos. Su plan futuro es ampliar el local donde está ubicada su pulpería.
texts.en:
Damaris, 39, is from Granada, married and has two children.  She is in the grocery business but used to run a bakery with her husband.  When she noticed how many customers came in to buy bread she decided to set up a grocery store and offer a variety of products to the same customers.  Her goal is to increase sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil and sodas, as well as other products.  She believes the loan will be very helpful because she will be able to keep items stocked for the customers in an aim to increase her income.  Her plans for the future are to expand the store.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, sodas and other products.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35 year old married male who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda.John practices farming where by he grows sugarcane on a large scale. He started business so as to employ himself. John  has got dream of educating his children to university.However, he is challenged by weather changes, seasonal changes, and price fluctuations.He needs a loan to pay for labour to weed his garden.

loans.use: to pay for labour to weed his garden.

loans.name: Juana Elba

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bankito Rio Bravo.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo  4 hijos mayores  de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Juana es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa , en la cual además de vender víveres también vende helados y otras bebidas, ella también después de la muerte de su esposo y con la ayuda de sus hijos tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio familiar, ellos se dedican  a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), mientras sus hijos se encargan de la ladrillera ella en su casa se dedica a atender su negocio y los pedidos de ladrillos que luego sus hijos entregan en el sitio a comerciantes que llevan a diferentes lugares de la provincia.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, helados, tierra y madera para elaborar los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre los  créditos le ayudan a mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños son que su negocio crezca aun más.
texts.en:
In Río Bravo de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products including straw hats ("panama hats") known both within the country and outside, the members of the "Bankito Río Bravo" Communal Bank meet every fifteen days. Here 55 year old Juana lives. Her husband passed away several years ago but from this relationship she has four adult children. Three of these children still live with her.

Juana is a hard working woman who has a small store within her home where she sells groceries, as well as ice cream and drinks.  After her husband died, and with the help of her children, she also builds bricks (for housing construction).  While her children work on the brick-making she attends to her her business and the brick orders that her children deliver to merchants who then carry them to different areas of the province. 

This loan will be used to buy groceries and ice cream, as well as to buy wood and soil to make the bricks. She has been with the Communal Bank since it began and she likes it because the loans help her to improve her business. Her dream is for her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy groceries, ice cream, earth and wood.

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Madame Korotimi est âgée  de 50 ans, mariée  et mère de cinq  enfants. Elle vit chez son beau frère  dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Secoura de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales  elle abandonna prématurément l’école et commença le  commerce des produits artisanaux (pagnes, vêtements mouchoirs, napperons, tapis…, tous teintés de façon artisanale) . Elle mène cette activité génératrice de revenue depuis 15 ans, elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Sa force de vente est due à son courage et au sens élevé des affaires. 
 Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. Elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 8 ans. Après  8 prêts individuels  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 9éme  prêt, qu’elle compte utiliser  pour  acheter 50 mètres de tissus, 5 sacs de galama et 10 sacs de pekou, elle s’approvisionne sur place.  
Madame   Korotimi   vend ses articles artisanaux au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte nationale et internationale et elle participe beaucoup à des foires. Elle envisage de réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de150 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotimi, age 50, is married and the mother of five children. She lives at her brother-in-law's in a traditional family in Secoura, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

For social reasons, she prematurely dropped out of school and started selling crafts, such as pagnes (colorful African cloth), clothes, handkerchief, doilies, carpets, etc, all dyed according to to traditional methods.

She's been running this business for the last 15 years, and benefits from an extensive experience in this field. She's a strong seller, thanks to her courage and her highly-developed business sense.

She's seeking this loan in order to increase her working capital and satisfy the demands of her clientele. She's been in a business relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for eight years. After eight personal loan that were all repaid without problems, she's now seeking her ninth loan.

She intends to use it to buy 50 meters of fabric, 5 sacks of "galama" (leaves) and 10 sacks of "pekou" (tree bark). She gets her supplies locally. She sells her crafts for cash and often on credit, to a mixed-gender national and international clientele. She attends many fairs.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 315), to be used to cover part of the family's expenses and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make dye for crafts (leaves, tree bark) and fabric

loans.name: Carmen Porfiria

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bankito Rio Bravo.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 58 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Carmen tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual aunque muy pequeña tiene de todo para la satisfacción de sus clientes, además también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual hace tiempo atrás construyo unos pequeños corrales donde cría sus animalitos. Parte de este crédito también lo utiliza su marido en el cultivo de maíz ya que la siembra en el periodo invernal por lo cual en esta ocasión utiliza una parte del crédito para abonos e insecticidas que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha. Ella lleva 3 años con su tienda y con la cría de animales desde hace muchos años atrás.
Este crédito es para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes y víveres para surtir la tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque con el primer crédito surtió su tienda. Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
In Río Bravo de Montecristi, a city noted for its great diversity of typical products like the straw hats that are renowned both inside and outside the country, the members of the “Río Bravo” communal bank meet every 15 days. 

Carmen, 58, lives here and she is in a common law relationship from which she has six adult children; one of them still lives with them. Her husband is a farmer. 

Carmen has a small grocery store at home where she stocks everything to satisfy her customers. She also raises chickens and pigs for which she built some small corrals and a farm some time ago to raise her little animals in. Part of the loan will be used by her husband for his corn crop since the winter is the season for planting and he will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides to produce a good crops.

She has had the store for three years and the animal husbandry for many more years. This loan is to buy insecticides, fertilizers and groceries for her store.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because she stocked her store with her first loan. Her dream is to enlarge her business and to have it well-stocked.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, fertilizers and groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Cleofe

texts.en:
Ma. Cleofe is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Ma. Cleofe requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of coconut wine to sell.

Ma. Cleofe  has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Ma. Cleofe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 25 years old and  with one children.  With  children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for  years and sells a variety of items such as . 

In the future Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy soldering supplies and tools

loans.name: Habibata

texts.fr:
Madame Habibata est âgée  de 67 ans, mariée et mère de six  enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire au quartier  Missira de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elle fait le commerce de l’encens, des habits et chaussures. Elle mène cette activité génératrice de revenue depuis 15 ans, elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Sa force de vente est due à son courage et au sens élevé des affaires également à son accueille chaleureux. 
 Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour la satisfaction des demandes clientèle. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis  6 ans.  Après 6 prêts individuels correctement remboursés, elle est à son 7éme  prêt qu’ elle compte l’utiliser  pour  acheter 3 balles de pagne au Burkina Faso.  
Madame   Habibata   vend au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine chez elle et en ambulant. Elle envisage de réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de pérenniser et diversifiée son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Habibata, age 67, is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in Missira, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She sells incense, clothes, and shoes. She's been running this money-earning business for the last 15 years, and benefits from an extensive experience in this field.

She's a strong seller, thanks to her courage, her highly-developed business sense, and also her warm welcome. She's seeking this loan in order to bolster her working capital and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

She's been in a business relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for six years. After six personal loans that were repaid without problems, she's now seeking her seventh loan, which she intends to use to buy three bales of pagnes (colorful African cloth) in Burkina Faso.

She sells for cash and often on credit, at her home and as a traveling saleswoman, to a mostly female clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 105), which will enable her to provide for her children's needs and increase her working capital.

Her ambition is to diversify her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy 3 bales of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is 33 years old; he lives with his parents' family in Nablus. Nablus is a city in the northern West Bank, approximately 49 kilometers north of Jerusalem, with a population of 126,132.

Bashar asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house. With this loan, he wants to help his family  to improve the house and make it better which will allow them to live in the house with more psychological comfort. He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs and help his parents. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is 38 years old and has nine children. Meliza is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Meliza requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Meliza has been farming rice for  years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario de 36 años de edad, solamente tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 3° grado, ella está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  son padres de tres hijos de 4, 14 y 16 años de edad, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela.

 Rosario ha sido agricultora toda su vida, desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar  junto a sus padres , ahora siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz  y  otros 7,000 de  yuca y todo esto lo realiza junto a su esposo, además trabaja como jornaleros junto a su esposo por temporadas y cuando tienen tiempo libre.


El crédito será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas, para realizar sus cultivos. El sueño de Rosario es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y tengan un buen empleo, también le gustaría tener ganado.
texts.en:
Rosario, 36, only has a third grade education.  She and her husband are farmers and the parents of three children, ages 4, 14 and 16.  Two of them attend school.

Rosario has been a farmer all her life and learned the trade from her parents when she was very young.  Now she has 7,000 square meters of corn and another 7,000 square meters of yucca plant.  She and her husband also work as seasonal hired help on other farms in their free time.

The loan will be used to buy farm supplies for the crops.  Rosario dreams of her children getting a good education and good jobs.  She also would like to have livestock.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Claudia Morena

texts.es:
Claudia de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado, es viuda, tiene un hijo de 9 años quien asiste a la escuela, de ella solo depende su hijo.

Desde la edad de 10 años Claudia trabaja en la agricultura,  sus ingresos dependen de esta actividad y siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz la cual junto a su hijo y el papá de ella, esta parcela está ubicada a 800 metros de su casa. 

El préstamo  será utilizado para la siembra de maíz y en la compra de los insumos que se necesitaran para ello. 

Su deseo es ayudar a su hijo para que sea una persona honesta, honrada y de bien para la familia y sociedad, ya que para ella es muy importante la preparación de su hijo, también le gustaría mejorar la vivienda y tener una novilla.
texts.en:
Claudia, 33, has a ninth grade education.  She is a widow and has a nine-year-old son who attends school and depends on her.

From the age of ten, Claudia has been working in agriculture and earning a living through this activity.  She has 7,000 square meters of corn that she plants with her son and her father.  The land is 800 meters from their house.

The loan will be used to buy the necessary supplies to plant the corn.

She wants to help her son become an honest man and good citizen, so providing him with an education is important to her.  She also wants to renovate her house and buy a heifer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her corn crop.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business.

Nora has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 34 years old and has four children. Rizalina is married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Rizalina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, raising pig Rizalina requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pig for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Rizalinais committed to rebuild her business. In future She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in Hoima Uganda.He is 26 years old and married with one child. He runs pork and earns additional income from cassava farming. He started business so as to improve on family earnings.His dream is to expand business and open up other outlets. 
He is acquiring a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy a plot of land

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda is 56 years old and lives in Sto. Nino, Pagadian City. She is married with no children.

Luzvisminda has an internet shop to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 25,000 a month doing this type of business. Luzvisminda has requested a loan to buy another set of computers for her internet shop.

Luzvisminda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Luzvisminda hopes to have another internet shop for expansion.

loans.use: to buy one set of computers

location.town: Pagadian-Purok Ferdinand, Santo Nino, Pagadian Cit

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old and has four children.  Sarah is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sarah has been farming rice for  years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, salt, and onion for her business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking man married with four children.He lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Christopher  practices farming in the rural area growing maize, beans. He faces a challenge of poor roads that makes transportation of his products to his customers difficult. Christopher has got dream of educating his children and a model farmer in his area.He needs a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to maize seeds  for planting.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Cecilia has a little store inside her house and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Cecilia hopes to build a sari-sari store outside her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Maria Suzarra

texts.en:
Maria Suzarra is married with two children. She is 41 years old and lives in Gatas, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maria Suzarra has owned a sari-sari store to earn a living for four years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more items such as basic commodities to restock her store to sell at retail.

Maria Suzarra is a new member of PMPC. In the future, She hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities to restock her store

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Elena, 52, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cesar, her business partner and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Elena dreams to expand her business and hopes to improve their quality of living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old from Nakuru and he is married to Divinah and they are blessed with two children aged 10 and 4 years old. 
 
He is a tailor, a business he has been running for the last six years and to enable him buy clothing materials, sewing thread and a new sewing machine, he has applied for his first loan of KES. 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 65,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund and to expand the current business.

Peter hopes to start a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials, sewing thread and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 23 years old from Nakuru and he is not yet married .

He is in the motorcycle transport sector, a business he has been running for the last five years and to enable him buy another motorcycle, he has applied for his second loan of KES. 95,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund and to start another business.

Shadrack hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Esther and they are blessed with three children aged 16, 12,and 8 years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last 14 years and to enable him buy two dairy cows, he has applied for his eighth loan of KES. 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 10,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund and to educate his children.

Francis hopes to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 45 years old man from Kakamega married to Alice who is in juakali sector in the same county. They have 6 children aged 19, 17, 14, 13, 9 and 6 years old.

He operates a tailoring workshop dealing with seat covers and cushions a business he has done for the last 10 years earning an income of kes 4000 per month.

He is taking his second loan of kes 27,000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in a buying a new sewing machine and add rolls of fabric. The profits thereafter will be used to repay his loan and provide for the family needs.

His dream is to open a bigger workshop.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of fabric to use in making seat covers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en: Kefa used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell. He has got a retail business whereby she sells general merchandise. His business is located on a busy street where the general public can access him. Kefa  started the business so as to earn a living.Kefa  has got a dream of buying a plot however she is challenged with delay of customers to pay and inadequate capital for expansion. He intends to use the loan to  buy general merchandise like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a married and lives in Madaba, Jordan. She has been working in selling blankets for two years. She started her project when she sold a small amount of them to her neighbors. She sold it for a good price and realized that selling them might be profitable work. So, she started selling a larger quantity of them. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase a collection of clothes for the upcoming season hoping that this will raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is 44 years old, married and a resident of Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor. She earns a living through direct selling 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional inventories of RTW clothing and plastic ware.

Mitchel deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional RTW clothing and plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 36 years old lady from Kakamega she is married to Francis who is a farmer they have 4 children aged 13, 9, 5 and 3 years respectively.

She operates a retail shop a business she has done for the past 12 years earning a monthly income of kes 15000.

She is taking her fourth loan of Kes 50,000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in expanding her retail shop by bringing in variety of goods in bulk. She will use her anticipated profits repay her loan and do some savings.

She has a dream of opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff for resell like cartons of sweets, tealeaves, salt and tins of cooking oil.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 35 years old man from Kakamega married to Eunice who is a domestic farmer in the same county. They have 2 children aged 10 and 4 years old respectively.

He a large scale farmer mainly for maize a business he has done for the last 4 years earning an income of kes 14000 per month.

He is taking his fourth loan of kes 30,000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in  buying  preservatives and containers to use in preserving the maize. The profits thereafter will be used to buy fertilizer, pay laborers and repay his loan.

His dream is to become the supplier of maize in the region.

loans.use: To purchase sacks for storing harvested maize and buy the chemicals used for preserving the maize as they await for consumers to buy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen used her previous loan amount to buy beauty products. These included hairbands, hair oil, body lotion, hair chemicals, braids and weaves, deodorants and perfumes. It was profitable and she has been able to repay the loan well.

She will be using this loan to buy a hair dryer for use in her beauty salon. She also plans to buy a popcorn machine and thereby sell fried popcorn to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also repay the loan.

This is her eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid back her previous loans successfully. In future, Hellen hopes to open another beauty salon, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and a popcorn machine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 55, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marilyn dreams of having a grocery store and hopes to have a better life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is  Ugandan female who is responsible for taking care of three children living in Masindi Uganda. She has got a retail business whereby she sells general merchandise. Her business is located on a busy street where the general public can access her.Joan started the business so as to earn a a living.Joan has got a dream of enlarging her business however she is challenged by competition. She is acquiring a loan to  buy general merchandise like omo and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to  buy general merchandise like omo and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is married to a welder with two children. She is 30 years old. Valentine sells metals and other construction materials. She has requested the loan, to buy more metals for sale. With the profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for the better future.

loans.use: To buy more constructions supplies for sale.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal was born in 1976. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a contractor. Manal has been working at selling clothes that she gets from the free-zone market at wholesale prices for three years. She started her project at home. Now she is asking for a loan to buy new clothes that are requested in order to raise her sales and get good income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Feda

texts.en: Feda is 27 years old. She is married and has 3 children, and one of her children passed away recently. Her husband is a government employee. Feda has been working at selling blankets one year. One of the obstacles that she is facing is lack of marketing for her products. Now she is asking for a youth loan to buy new collection of blankets in order to raise her sales and get good income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more blankets for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34 years old man from Kakamega county which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man and supports 9 people in his family including his 5 children who are aged; 10, 7, 5, 3 and 1 years old respectively.

He sells new clothes a business he has been doing for the last 6 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 10000.

He is taking his fourth loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more clothes for resale and  he plans to use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of becoming a successful businessman and supports his family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Nzau

texts.en:
Nzau is a 37 year old retail shop proprietor at Majengo Mombasa Kenya. He is a married father of one whose spouse is a house wife and and has been in this business for the last fifteen years doing great.

This marks his third borrowing from Vision fund Kenya to finance his business after servicing his loan successfully. He will use the money to open a second business of Mpesa(mobile money transfer business) and the anticipated profit to service his loan as well as increase his business float. 

He hopes to succeed in both businesses in future.

loans.use: to open a second business dealing in mobile money trasfer-Mpesa

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and has a retail shop which she has been running for three years now. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. Her spouse does provide additional income for the support of the family.

She will be using the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, salt, soap, detergents, maize flour and wheat flour for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is Mary's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to educate her children and also grow her business and get more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39 years old lady who is married and she supports six people in her family.

She sells second hand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 7 years and generates a monthly income of Kes 25000. 

She has applied for her fifth loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to pay her children's school fees as she currently does not have enough capital.

loans.use: to take her children to college.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a 40 year retail proprietor at Kongowea Mombasa Kenya. She is a married mother of three whose spouse provides for additional income and has been in the retail business for the last forty years doing great.

This marks her second borrowing to finance her business, she will use the loan to purchase retail stock of cooking fat, sugar,milk , wheat and maize flour, anticipated profit to repay her loan. 

She hopes to grow her business to a whole sale in future.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock of cooking fat, sugar, milk, wheat and maize flour

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a 36 years old lady from kakamega region and she sells new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 1 year where she generates a monthly income of Kes 17500.

She has applied for her first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a wholesale shop for clothes and supports her family.

loans.use: to increase the clothes stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a retail shop in Nairobi town and has been running it for 3 years. She is 25 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. Her spouse also provides additional income. She makes a monthly income of KES 60,000.

She will be using the loan to purchase goods for resale. These include goods such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also repay the loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow and prosper in her business and family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resell in her shop.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla has a shoes selling business and has been running it for 6 years now. She is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She also supports five people in her family.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of shoes for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In future Priscilla hopes to build a house for her family as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39 years old mother from Kakamega region. She is a married woman and supports seven people in her family including her 7 children who are aged ; 19, 16, 12, 10, 7,and 3 years old respectively.

She has a food kiosk which has been operating for the last 5 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 4,000. She is taking her third loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastics seats, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a 51 years old man from Kakamega county, married and supports three people in her family including their one child who 9 years old.

She sells grains a business he has been doing for the last 6 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 10000. She is taking her fourth loan with VISION FUND KENYA which she will use to purchase more grains for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her a dream is to  become a successful businesswoman and supports her family.

loans.use: to boost her stock by adding more cereals

loans.name: Salamah

texts.en: Salamah is a 34 year old married female. She has got a retail business whereby she sells general merchandise such as cooking oil,soap,rice,sugar among others. Her business is located on a busy street where the general public can access her. Salamah started the business so as to create employment and support her family. Salamah has got a dream of enlarging her business to wholesale despite being challenged by competition and limited capital. She wants a loan to  buy general merchandise such as cooking oil,soap,rice,and cooking oil.

loans.use: to  buy general merchandise such as,cooking oil,soap,rice and cooking oil..

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en: Fayzeh was born in 1974. She is married and has five children. Fayzeh has been working at selling dresses and 'abayas' that she gets from the free-zone market at wholesale prices for four years. Now she is asking for a loan to buy new clothes and 'abayas' that are requested by customers in order to raise her sales and get good income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more dresses and abayas

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was able to add more stock of vegetables with her previous loan and she has also seen an increase in her profits.

She has applied for her second loan of kshs. 10,000 and she will also use this to add more stock of vegetables for resale including green peppers, tomatoes and onions as well as fruits.

She hopes to see her businesses grow and be able to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to increase the vegetables and fruits stock.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used his previous loan to buy textile materials for sewing suits. He also bought threads and buttons. It was profitable and he has successfully paid the loan.

He will be using this loan to buy fabric materials for tailoring. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan as well as expand his business.

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to be successful and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy  fabric materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 26 year old man kakamega county, married to Miriam who is a business woman in the same county. They have been blessed with two children aged 12, and 6 respectively.

He does dairy farming a business he has done for the last 6 years earning a monthly income of kes 7000.

He is taking his second loan of kes 30000 with Vision fund Kenya which he intends to use in expanding his business and part of it educate his children. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more shares to Vision fund Kenya.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow to enable him produce more milk to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 32 year old man Kakamega county married to Grace who is a business woman in the same county. They have two children aged 7  and 2 years old respectively.

He is a dairy farmer a business he has done for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of kes 6000. He is taking his second loan of kes 30000 with Vision fund Kenya which he intends to use in expanding his business and part of it educate his children. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more share to Vision fund Kenya.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and medicine to treat the cows so as they be in good health to enable them produce quality milk for resell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, inicio con la venta de verduras y hace un año decidió vender sandalias, productos plásticos, ganchos, colas y otra mercadería. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras, con el fin de comprar productos plásticos, sandalias, bóxer y mas para vender y mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es establecer bien su negocio en la comunidad  y asegurar el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Josefina is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. She has always been a merchant. She started by selling vegetables and a year ago started selling sandals, plastic products, hooks, glues and other merchandise. She has this business in her house. She has asked for a loan of 10,000 lempiras, in order to buy plastic products, sandals, boxers and more to sell and improve her business. Her dream is to really establish her business in the community and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, sandals, boxers and more to sell and improver her business.

loans.name: Hamam

texts.en:
Hamam is a 20 years old single young man from Deir el balah city. he lives with his family in a very simple house.his father works as a teacher in a local school with a very low income. Hamam is a student in a local university where he studies Finance. Hamam would like to finish his study and find a job. 
Hamam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. by taking this loan, Hamam will be able to do his home works and write the reports easily. 
Hamam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 20 years old married man from Deir el Balah city. he is a father for one small son. Rami works in a Laundry store where he uses dry clean machines. it is a very good project and the only one in his area. Rami would like to improve his business and expand it. 
Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy an iron and steam machine for his store. by taking this loan, Rami will be able to improve his business and increase the income. 
Rami appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy an iron and steam machine for his store

loans.name: Nyakyanikka Ii Women Group

texts.en:
Jamilar is a 34 year old married female, living in Masindi-Uganda. She is responsible of educating her four children. Jamilar has got a restaurant business that sells food and soft drinks in a rural area. She practices farming  as an additional source of income. With the loan she wants to buy more food for her restaurant. Jamilar has hopes of building her own house and educating her children to university level.
Jamilar is a member of Nyakyanikka II Women Group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan a.

loans.use: to buy more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 34 years old married woman from Bethlehm city. she is a mother for five kids; three sons and two daughters. all of them are under 10 years old. Ruba works as a nurse in a local hospital where she gets a low income. few years ago Ruba and her husband started their own project which is cleaning carpets. they use a very good quality of Cleaning materials. 
Ruba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a special machine for cleaning carpets. by taking this loan, Ruba and her husband will be able to increase their productivity and also their income. 
Ruba appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a special machine for cleaning carpets.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 37 years old married woman from a small village near Nablus. she is a mother for three sons and two daughters. for the past two years, Heyam opened a small workshop for sewing. she takes orders from the local traders for sewing clothes. Heyam would like to improve her business and expand it. 
Heyam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. by taking this loan, Heyam will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 
Heyam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Alicia Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito El Oro De Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Alicia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de  13 años la cual estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
