Doña Alicia junto a su esposo se  dedican al comercio, desde hace  17 se dedican a la venta de artesanías, ellos viajan cada cierto tiempo a su ciudad natal que es Otavalo en la cual compran ropa con diseños típicos elaborados por artesanos de esa parte del país, tienen un local en Montecristi el cual venden estos productos que son de mucha acogida en este lugar ya que son  obras hermosas que ellos las venden a un precio adecuado, también recorren otras ciudades de la costa en ferias y fiestas patronales que es cuando más ventas tienen, esta es su forma de ganarse la vida con un trabajo honrado y honesto buscando un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y otras artesanías. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben con los créditos. Sus sueños es ver que su hija termine sus estudios y sea una gran  profesional.
texts.en:
The El Oro De Montecristi credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handmade crafts that are known nationally and internationally. It is famous for its paja toquilla hats. 

This is where Alicia lives. She is 33 years old, married and from this relationship has a 13 year old daughter who is in high school. Her husband is a merchant. Alicia works as a merchant with her husband. For 17 years, she has sold handmade crafts. They travel regularly to their native city, which is   Otavalo. They buy clothes there with traditional designs made by artisans from that part of the country. They have a locale in Montecristi  where they sell these products which are very popular there, since they are beautiful and they sell them a a good price. They also go to other cities on the coast for fairs and patron saint festivals, which is when they sell the most. This is their way of earning a living with honest and honorable work, seeking a better future.   

This loan is to buy clothes and other handmade crafts. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because of the help with getting the loans. Her dream is to see her daughter finish her education and have a great career.

loans.use: to buy clothes and handmade crafts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Ugandan married woman who lives in Masindi,Uganda.She used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has got a retail business whereby she sells general merchandise. Her business is located on a busy street where she supplies to the general public.  Jane started the business so as to earn a living and educate her children.She has got a dream of educating her children to a level of self dependency although her problem is inadequate capital. She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: She wants a loan to to pay school fees.

loans.name: Anichka

texts.en:
Anichka and her son have been occupied in breeding cattle for 3 years. 
The cattle isn't big (only 3 cows). Anichka gets milk and uses it in cheese production. Income from agribusiness is very important for Anichka and she would like to enlarge it. Therefore Anichka applied for this loan of USD 3000 to be able to purchase 3 more cows for livestock. 
As this is Anichka's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
Samson fait partie du groupe Shingimizi. Il habite à Bujumbura et est marié à Médiatrice, une commerçante. 

Il fait le commerce de briques cuites depuis  2 ans. 

Il  est  à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bois de chauffage pour cuire les briques à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une maison dans sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Samson is part of Shingimizi Group. He lives in Bujumbura and is married to Médiatrice, a merchant.

He's been selling baked bricks for the last two years. He is seeking his first loan from Turame.

With this Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of firewood to make baked bricks to resell, in order to increase his income.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to build a house on his land lot and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy firewood to make baked bricks

loans.name: Fasayel

texts.en: Fasayel was born in 1981. She is a hard-working married woman who is a mother of 5. Her husband is a retired man. eight months ago, she started up a small business selling shoes to support her husband financially. She is trying her best to make her business grow and turn it into a successful one. Now Fasayel has applied for a loan to buy a larger quantity of shoes to raise her profit.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of shoes to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty eight year old married male with four children and all go to school. He has been in retail business for ten years, works seven days a week and twelve hours a day located in the rural area plus farming as additional income. Stephen started business to improve on his lifestyle and needs a loan to buy clothes, sugar and salt to sell. Stephen hopes to become a great businessman however, poor climatic conditions affect his crops and price fluctuations affect his retail business. Stephen is a hardworking man who appreciates Kiva for the services rendered to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Madame Haby est née en  1955 à Zingaso, mariée,  mère de 6 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux dans une famille traditionnelle à Hamdallaye un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame Haby mène des activités d’achat et de vente des calebasses il ya 15 ans, elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Bla.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un huitième prêt individuel. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importantes de calebasses pour la revendre au détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haby was born in 1955 in Zingaso. She's married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband in a traditional family in Hamdallaye, a working class neighborhood in Sikasso, a city in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mrs. Haby has been buying and selling calabashes for the last 15 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Bia. 

In order to satisfy the needs of an ever-increasing clientele, she's seeking her eighth personal loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

This loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of calabashes to retail at her place and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 84). One part of it will enable her to repay the loan and interest, the remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy calabashes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stationary products and women accessories

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine lives in Sisian with her husband and little kid. Arpine and her husband run a small farm. It includes cows, and also an arable land where emmer wheat and potato are cultivated. The couple works hard to be able to run the farm in sustainable way and gather good income for their living. Willing to improve conditions of the farm, Arpine has applied for this loan of USD 3000. It will enable her to purchase seeds, fertilizer and 4 more calves for her farm. As this is Arpine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 
Let's help this hardworking young family to enlarge their farm and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and 4 calves

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda was born in 1952. She is a married woman and has 6 sons. Her husband is a driver. Hamda started running her mini market 3 years ago to support her husband with the household expenses and it was a good source of income for the family. Now her mini market is out of products, and she is seeking a loan to merchandise it with new food products.

loans.use: To merchandise her store with new food products

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is 32 years old and a married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Kaneez’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kaneez has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle with some auto spare parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires  with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20 years old single man from Deir el balah city. he lives with his family in a simple house. Mohammad is a university student in his second year. he also works in an old rickshaw he owns. he transferes goods to the local traders. Mohammad uses this income to cover the educational expenses he has. 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. by taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Kweterana Kyabatega Farmers Group

texts.en:
Tegrasi is a 74 year old married male who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Tegrasi grows maize, groundnuts, sunflower, and burns charcoal to supplement his income. He needs a loan to buy maize for planting this peak season. Tegrasi has got dream of building a house and educating her children. However he is challenged by weather plus seasonal changes, and price fluctuations.He needs a loan for to buy maize for planting this peak season.
Tegrasi is a member of Kweterena Kyabatega group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting this peak season.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband(also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. They have been doing it for the past five years.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, beverages, flour and grains to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, beverages, flour and grains.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 42 years old married woman; she is doing business manufacturing carpets for many years. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous for providing good quality products in her area. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is mother of six children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support of it. Currently she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.  She expects boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Zubada

texts.en: Zubada is 44 years old married woman. She is running a small beauty parlor for many years in her community. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  So she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed her 7th loan of 50,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater more customers time after time. She expects boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is 32 years old, married woman and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Bushra’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Bushra has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 44-year-old, energetic widow. She has a business manufacturing stoves in various sizes. She has become famous for providing good-quality cement stoves in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation; currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase good-quality cement and some tools used in making stoves. It will help her to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cement and some tools used in making stoves

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 34 years old. He lives with his mother in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. Mahmoud is taking care of his mother after his fathers death as he doesn't have any siblings. He currently works in a governmental entity. But after he experienced the work life, he noticed that he will need to get a Bachelor degree in order to find a good job. So has registered into university after that, and he is currently in his last year. Mahmoud is facing financial crisis which is not helping him in paying his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Agarak with her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter). 
The family owns a farm which includes 3 cows, 5 calves and arable land. Nora cultivates potato and some grass as forage for the livestock. Nora's sons help their parents to sell the gathered harvest in local market and gather income for sustaining their living. 
Nora, has now applied for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase a cow, forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. This loan will be a big support for Nora's farm and she hopes for lenders' goodwill. 
As this is Nora's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Gulam  Fiza

texts.en: Gulam Fiza is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to contribute in the family income. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, she will not be able to meet her household expenses. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Afza

texts.en: Afza is 43 years old lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more customers consistently. She is in her 9th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running business manufacturing footballs for many years with her husband(also shown in the photo). She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers and threads in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers and threads in a large quantity.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is 44 years old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving rickshaw for last 8 years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Hameedan has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some tools.

loans.name: Losseny

texts.fr:
Monsieur Losseny est né en Octobre 1977 à Niéna, il est marié, père de 3 enfants et il réside avec son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à Médine un quartier populaire de la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Il  mène des activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers  il ya plus de 4 ans, il s’approvisionne à Burkina-Faso.
 Il est à son sixième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importantes des  articles divers (vêtements, chaussures, parures) pour la revendre au détail à ses camarades d’enseignants au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Losseny was born in October 1977 in Niéna. He is married and the father of 3 children and lives with his wife in a nuclear family in Médine, a popular district of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Losseny has been buying a selling various items for over 4 years. He gets his supplies in Burkina-Faso. He is on his 6th individual loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better satisfy his growing clientèle. This loan will enable him to buy various products (clothes, shoes and accessories) so that he can resell them retail to his fellow teachers for cash or credit. He expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs. This profit will enable him to repay the loan and the interest, and the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Mariano Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariano vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y se dedica a la construcción de casas y en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mariano lives in the community of Mojopata. He works as a construction worker, and during his free time he raises small animals such as guinea pigs. He has been raising animals for some years now and is doing well thanks to his hard work. He is a member of the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” [Mojopata’s Rising Sun].

Mariano is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs. He appreciates this loan and promises to pay the installments responsibly. The community of Mojopata is located in Challabamba District belonging to Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is 38 years old married woman and running business selling animals for many years. She buys various small animals at low prices, raises them for a year or two and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 8th loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will help her to purchase more animals. She expects boost in her earnings and dreams of providing better standard of living to her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Zubaid

texts.en: Zubaid is 33 years old, married woman. She has three children. She has been weaving sweaters for the past 5 years. She works hard on her weaver every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education to her children.  Currently she has applied for her third loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this amount to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales.  She dreams of expanding her business for the prosperous future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Maqadas

texts.en: Maqadas is 35 years old married woman. She has five children. The man shown in the photo is Maqadas’s husband. They have been running a cold drink stall in their community for many years. By the time they become famous in their town and earns good amount of income to contribute in the family income. For the improvement of their business Maqadas applied a loan of PKR 45,000. In this way she will be able to purchase stock of sugar, beverages, and juices with some utensils such as glasses and bottles. She hopes to get increase in their net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, beverages, and juices with some utensils such as glasses and bottles.

loans.name: Rubab

texts.en: Rubab is 23 year old lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Kerfas

texts.en:
Kerfas is a 42 years old man from Kakamega he is married to Flora and they have 3 children aged 13, 8 and 4 years old.

He operates a poshomill a business he has done for the past 5 years earning an income of kes 7000 monthly. 

He is taking a second loan of kes 30000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in purchasing fuel and spare parts for the poshomill machine. He plans to use profits in improving the lives of his family members.

His dream is to open another poshomill in a different place.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and spare parts for the poshomill machine.

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en: Faiz is 52 years old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has 01 buffalo for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. She sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. It’s 5th year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. It will help her to increase sales and earnings alongside. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman. She is mother of 4 children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education .She is doing business manufacturing knives for the past 3 years with the support of husband.  She offers various handmade knives in different types, and has become famous for providing good quality knives in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. In order to increase in production of knives, she needs to purchase iron, steel and wooden handles in large quanity. For this reason she applied a loan of PKR 45,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history. She expects boost in her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase iron, steel and wooden handles.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem, age 41, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals with the support of her husband.  She buys different animals at low prices, raises them for a year or two and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. At present she has one cow and some calves. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.  She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 7rd loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 50000 to purchase one buffalo. She expects boost in her earnings and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Shumaila is 32 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shumaila’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shumaila has applied for a loan of PKR45000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shumaila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some tools.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un cultivateur de maraîchage d'onions basé dans le village de mbane, son âge s'élève à 39 ans, il est marié et père de 10 enfants, il exerce cette activité de maraîchage depuis qu'il est petit en accompagnant ses parents, ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter du semence d'onions de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il a comme projet d'avenir d'augmenter sa production en qualité et en quantité pour pouvoir toucher d'autres clients qui sont établis au niveau des villages environnants.
texts.en: Ibrahima is an onion grower who lives in the village of Mbane. He is 39 years old, married and the father of 10 children. He started market gardening alongside his parents when he was very young. This loan will enable him to buy onions seeds, herbicide and fertilizers. In the coming years, he aims to increase both the quality and the quantity of his production so that he can reach more customers from the surrounding villages.

loans.use: to buy onions seeds, herbicide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Seydou est un cultivateur d'onions basé dans le village de mbane, il est marié et père de 4 enfants, son âge s'élève à 31 ans, il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage depuis qu'il est tout petit avec ses parents, ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il envisage à l'avenir d'augmenter sa production en terme de qualité et de quantité.
texts.en: Seydou is an onion grower who lives in the village of Mbane. He is 31 years old, married and the father of 4 children. He started market gardening alongside his parents when he was very young. This loan will enable him to buy onions seeds, herbicide and fertilizers. In the coming years, he plans to increase both the quality and the quantity of his production.

loans.use: to buy onions seeds, herbicide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Attia

texts.en: Attia, age 31, is a married woman. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Attia has applied for a loan of KR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Attia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 24-year old single lady. She, along with her brother (who is also shown in the photo with her), is in the business of making aluminum doors and windows. They have been doing it for the past four years. The business has great potential for growth and Nadia is actively helping her brother as this business is the only source of income for them. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Nadia requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as iron, nail, steel and glass in large quantity. She hopes to get increase in their net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as iron, nail, steel and glass in large quantity.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Kishwar is 35 years old, married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Kishwar’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. Now he wants to purchase new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. For this reason, Kishwar has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 through Kashf Foundation. Kishwar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and dreams of providing better quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and millet for resale.

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: Mame Diarra  est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans. Elle demande ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter et revendre des produits cosmétiques comme le lait de corps, les huiles de beauté, les savons et d’autres produis divers. Elle a comme charge particulière les soins médicaux. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer  à 18h. Elle souhaite épargner de l’argent et à l’avenir ouvrir une grande boutique de produits cosmétiques et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Mame Diarra is a promoter who sells beauty products. She is married and a mother. She has over 3 years experience in her line of work. She is requesting this 100 000 franc loan in order to be able to buy and resell beauty products like body milk, beauty oils, soaps and various other products. She is responsible for taking care of the medical expenses. She starts her workday at 9am and finishes it at 6pm. She would like to save some money and, in the coming years, open a large shop selling beauty products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Durren

texts.en:
Durren raises animals to earn a living.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase piglets and sacks of feeds.  She also needs to renovation of her pig cage.

Durren dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

Durren joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last year and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education offered by the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 43 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Elizabeth and they are blessed with three children aged 15, 13 and 9 years old.

He is in the motorcycle transport sector, a business he has been running for the last four years and to enable him start a fruits and vegetables business for his spouse, he has applied for his third loan of KES. 54,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 20,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund,to start another business and to educate his children.

Paul hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to start a fruits and vegetable business for his spouse

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used the loan that he was given to buy fertilizers, seeds and paid for the labor charges. 

Daniel has applied for another loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy a cow. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan. 

He hopes to prosper more in the future and uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to pay labourers for help

loans.name: Carmen Judith

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito El Oro De Montecristi que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar  vive la señora Carmen, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 20 Y 18 años, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor  en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, electrodomésticos y muebles, estos productos los vende por catálogos así como también productos de Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días o como sus clientes quieran, a ella le gusta darles facilidades a sus clientes ya que es así como gana más clientela, lleva 6 años en este negocio con el cual ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes y varios productos más que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “El oro de Montecristi” [The gold of Montecristi] meets fortnightly in the Montecristi canton, which is famous for its pre-colonial culture and its world-famous handicrafts. This is where the famous panama hat is made and where Carmen, 40, lives. She is married and has three children aged 22, 20 and 18. The oldest ones go to college and the youngest one is still in school. Her husband is a driver.

Carmen is a very good mother and wife. She helps her husband to cover the home expenses, working as a saleswoman. She sells all kinds of clothes, electrical appliances and furniture on a catalog. She also sells Belcorp products such as perfumes and imitation jewelry door to door. She sells on credit and normally collects every week, but she likes to give her customers flexible payment options, which has been a good strategy to attract more customers. She has had this business for six years and this is how she helps her children with their studies.

With this loan, Carmen will buy clothes, creams, perfumes and some other products she usually sells. She has been a member of the communal bank since it began and she likes the group because she feels that the loans have helped her to get ahead. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the materials needed in her tailoring business. Her loan helped not just her business but also with the education of her children.  Her income from business helps to pay for everyday household expenditures.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.
 
Arlene would like a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed for her business. Her profits will help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene hopes that her business will grow and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other items needed for her business.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia, age 51, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them for a year or two and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 3rd loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 40000. This will help her to purchase more animals. She expects boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is a mother of two little kids ages 2 and 3 years old. 
Together with her husband Lyudmila runs a small farm. They keep three cows, 4 oxen and cultivate wheat and grass. They are very enthusiastic about willing to improve family’s social condition.
Lyudmila applied for this loan of USD 3000 to be able to enrich her livestock by 7 more oxe. As this is Lyudmila's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 
The loan is important for Lyudmila and she will hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 7 oxen

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 29 year old male, he lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Joshua has got a stationery business located in Buliisa Town Council where the general public can access him. Joshua had savings from the former employer thus started a mobile money business(it involves sending and receiving money on mobile phones) that generates side income. He has a great dream to build a permanent house .However he is challenged by inadequate capital. He wants a loan wants a loan to invest in mobile money business.

loans.use: to invest in mobile money business.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 58-year-old member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, from Siari, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married and has seven children. 

She runs a fishing business.  She personally takes charge of the family business, and their children work for the business. The business is doing well. Antonina has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time earn a living. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Antonina is seeking a loan for her son who is planning to work abroad.  She is requesting PHP 35,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to pay the placement fee and other processing requirements for son to work abroad. 

The income of her fishing business will be used to pay-off the loan. Antonina deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay the placement fee and other processing requirements for son to work abroad.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita, age 52, is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao: Philippines.  She is married and they have eight children.

Pablita operates a "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business.  And she became active with Paglaum MPC in 2007.  Its financial assistance helped her family survive. She gives her best efforts to make sales daily in spite of stiff competition from other stores in her area. 

Pablita hopes to expand her "Sari-Sari" store business and has also wants to venture into fishing. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance a loan of PHP 14,000.  

She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy boat engine for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mechanical tools

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 33 years old from Nyandarua and is married.

Isaac has a motorcycle transport business that he has been running for the past 3 years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy another motorbike and employ someone to use the new one. 

He hopes to get a bigger loan in the future to enable him boost his business and family livelihood.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old from Nyandarua South and is single.

Joseph has a retail business that he has been running for two years now. He has applied for his second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy more stock of sweets, groundnuts etc. He hopes to use the profits made to buy a cow.

He hopes to get a bigger loan in the near future and be able to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, sweets etc

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is now 48 years and her two adult children are doing well with their own families.

She was able to buy herbicides and pesticides with the last loan advanced to her and she is happy with the progress of her business. She is just about to start a new season in farming and to prepare she has asked for another loan to buy some maize seeds and fertilizers .

She plans to the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy a dairy cow and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy maize planting seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 39 years old married to Martin and together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She is in farming business in Ndunyu njeru which she has practiced for twelve years and has applied for first loan from Vision Fund kenya to enable her buy fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay the loan and expand her farming business.

In the near future, she hopes to boost her farming business and improve her family living standards.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 52 years old from Nyandarua and is married. They have three children who are aged between 17 years and 8 years old.

Stanley has a farming business that he has been doing for many years and has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings and also pay for labour.

He hopes to earn more from his farming so as to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy supplies of raw materials like wood, nails, and other materials needed to construct modular cabinets. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and fund her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann's past loan enabled her to buy school supplies and to support her cabinet business. She is accepting orders for modular cabinets from hotels and other establishments. The loan also helped her educate her children and support her everyday household expenditures.
 
Mary Ann dreams to have more customers and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to talk about life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and other materials needed to make modular cabinets.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak lives in Ani Kayaran village with her 23-years-old son. She is a farmer who keeps livestock (5 cows, pig, 3 calves and chickens) and also cultivates wheat. The family's only income is from agriculture and that's the reason Arusyak does her best to run her farm in sustainable way. 
Willing to improve her agribusiness, Arusyak has applied for this loan of USD 1500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for the livestock. This loan will give her an opportunity to enlarge cultivation and gather more harvest. 
As this is Arusyak's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 
Please help Arusyak with the loan that is important to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 55 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They have four children who are aged between 28 years and 17 years old.

She has a farming business that she has been running for many years. Serah has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy more cattle to add to what she has.

She hopes to get a bigger loan to improve her family and business life.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Murimi

texts.en:
Murimi is 49 years old from Nyandarua South and is married with four children who are aged between 18 years and 6 years old.

Murimi has a Garage business that he has been running for many years and has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy machines like the lifting machine to use in his garage. 

He hopes to improve his business in the near future and improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a machine

loans.name: Yên

texts.en:
yên operates a fishing business, is 32 years old, married and has three children and two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  yên has run her business for more than 10 years.

In 2010, yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan.

The main hardship yên faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and filter.

With her business profit, yên hopes to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and filter.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business helps her pay for the family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlita dreams that her business will grow and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus is 38-years-of mother of 6 children. Her elder daughter is 18 years old and little one is new born. 
Together with her husband, Arus is involved in agriculture. They run a small farm which includes livestock (3 cows and 20 chickens) as well as grow 120 apricot trees. AAs the family is big, it is very difficult for Arus and her husband to cover even minimal needs. They work day and night for being able to sustain their children’s' life. Arus has now applied for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase two oxen, 6 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock and enrich her livestock. As this is Arus's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, 6 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Sumber Kelapa Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Kelapa group consist of 11 women who operate various businesses. One member resigned because she needed to follow her husband to work in the city.  She was replaced by her friend and the group also has one new member.

Hasunah, 53, will use her loan to purchase more merchandise for her kiosk, such as rice, oil, kitchen items, snacks, shampoo, soap etc.  She has a dream to enlarge her kiosk.  She hopes to save all the profit and make her dream come true.  She says thank you to lenders, KIVA and MUK for their financial support.

Hasunah and her group has had a previous loan.  Her goal to boost her income was very successful.  She increased sales and earnings, so she could pay off the loan quickly.  Now she has a successful business and she can help increase her support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Masyurianto

texts.en:
Masyurianto has made an earlier payment. The due date was in July. But, Masyurianto had a big order and he earned a profit. He was very happy for that. To enlarge his bussines, Masyurianto is re-applying for loans to MUK. With the increased loan size of 10.000.000 IDR, Masyurianto will buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities like nails, saws, hammers and others to build a house. The loan will also support his wife's bussines as a honey and snails seller. The snails are usually used for chips.
In pursuing this business, Masyurianto is hoping to get satisfactory results. He could meet the needs of the family and he will save all the profit to support his business.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities like nails, saws, hammers and others to build a house and support his wife's business as a honey and snail seller.

loans.name: Seik

texts.en:
Seik is a resident who lives in the Baray district in the Kampong Thom province. She is 56 years old and a married mother of three children, two of whom are married. So only her youngest child still lives with her and is a dependent. Seik uses her own farmland for planting rice. Every day she spends many hours taking care of her rice crops because it is the source of income for her family.

Seik is asking for a loan to buy a wallboard to make some home improvements. This will bring them comfortable living conditions and improve their quality of life. She extends a big thank you to the Kiva lenders who donate their funds to enable poor families to overcome the hardships in their lives.

loans.use: to buy a wallboard to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is a 37-year-old married man and a father of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in a business of vending dried fish and has been in this business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Quirino is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this, he will be able to improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more dried fish to the market. In the future, Quirino hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda used the previous loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell. He is still in produce business in Katulikire trading centre.He also does farming to add on his income to cater for the family. Geofrey has been in business since 2005 and has managed to fulfill his dream of educating his children to university even if he is challenged with inadequate capital. He is requesting for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and  beans to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 65-years-old from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and other home made snack foods.

Rosita is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like bananas, flour, sugar, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more which will improve her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, flour, sugar, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Genny Elsa

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bankito Rio Bravo.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny,  tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tienen cinco hijos de 19, 15, 12, 9 y  7 años, los tres  mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo fabrica ladrillos.
Doña Genny es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas)  el junto a dos personas más elaboran estos ladrillos los mismos que entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar, los mismos que luego se  encargan de  llevarlos a vender o entregar directo a las construcciones de viviendas, es así como el se gana el sustento y nunca les ha faltado nada.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, aserrín y tierra que se necesitan para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.  Sus sueños son comprar un camión para llevara a vender los ladrillos directamente.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the "Grupo de Crédito Bankito Rio Bravo" or "Rio Bravo Small Bank Loan Group" meet. Rio Bravo of Montecristi is known for its great diversity of traditional products like straw hats and shawls that are know inside and outside the country.
Genny lives in this place. She is 43 years old. She is married and from this marriage they have 5 children ages 19, 15, 12, 9, and 7. The three eldest study in high school and the three youngest grade school. Her husband makes bricks.
Genny is a very good wife that is requesting a loan so that her husband can use it in his work. He makes bricks for a living (a material used in the construction of housing). With two people making these same bricks with the same delivery to merchants that come to the site. which are then responsible to selling them or delivering them directly to the construction site, they will increase their sustenance and never be in need.
This loan is to purchase the wood, sawdust and soil that is necessary to make the bricks. She has been in the "Grupo de Crédito" since the beginning and likes it because the loans are of much help. Her dreams are to buy a truck to carry the bricks to sell directly.

loans.use: to buy wood, sawdust and soil.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
This is Ester, 55, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Lauro, a mechanic and they have children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ester operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. 

She makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Ester is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ester dreams that her business will continue grow and hopes to improve her family’s way of living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. Her eldest is 19-years-old and her youngest is 6-years-old. Marilou and her husband are engaged in a bakery and a welding shop, and also in refrigeration and television repair services. This business started 10 years ago. These are the sources of their income.

Marilou is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, baking soda, flavorings, cooking oil, etc.  With this, she will be able to bake more breads which she can then sell in her store. Marilou dreams of improving her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, baking soda, flavorings, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is a 46-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has eight children.  Most of her children are currently studying in school.  She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. Ma. Magdalina also runs a sari-sari store business. 

Ma. Magdalina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and additional stock for her store like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus, giving them more fish to sell.  At the same, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus, attracting more buyers. In the future, Ma. Magdalina hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save extra money for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and additional stock for her store

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik studies in Medical University. He is from Tsaghkaber village of Lori region where currently lives his family: parents, brother and sister. Andranik himself lives in Yerevan, where the university is located. His family is engaged in agriculture and time by time supports Andranik financially. However, as there are many costs to cover Andranik faces some financial difficulties. He has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition and continue his studies there. 
This future doctor will be very grateful if lenders support him with his tuition fee and will wait for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 50 year old married male living in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Fred practices farming where by he grows maize. He started the business so as to earn a living.Fred has got dream of educating his children. However he is challenged with weather changes  and the bad roads that make transportation of his products to his customers difficult.Fred has asked for a loan to buy maize seeds ahead of the planting season.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her family are occupied in breeding cattle and in land cultivation. She is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. The requested loan of USD 1500 will help her buy seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock.
Karine lives with her husband and 22-years-old son who help her with farming activities. The whole family hopes to receive lenders' support and get an opportunity to improve their farm. 
Karine has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Karine has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, fuel for land cultivationa nd forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kdep

texts.en:
Kdep is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She owns and operates a farm, where she grows rice to earn a living. Her products are harvested and sold into the local markets of the province. She has been doing this for over 10 years and earns a moderate income for her family. Kdep and her family rely on income generated from agriculture, and she earns additional income from selling charcoal. 

By applying for this loan of 1,000 USD, Kdep wants to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. This latrine will improve her household's sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Kdep is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her family members.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Steven has got a spare parts business in Bweyale town council.He started the business so as to cater for the family. Steven has been in business since 2009 and he used the proceeds to provide basic needs for his family. He intends to use the loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles. His dreams are to educate his children to university and expand his business into new markets. Even if he is challenged by inadequate capital and high license fees.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Baba est un cultivateur basé à saneinte, il est marié et père de 5 enfants, son âge s'élève à 57 ans, il a commencé cette activité de culture maraîchère depuis qu'il est tout petit avec ses parents, ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il a envisagé à l'avenir d'accroître sa production et aussi diversifier ses cultures afin de toucher d'autres clients vers d'autres villages.
texts.en: Baba is a farmer who lives in Saneinte. He is 57 years old, married and the father of 5 children. He started market gardening at a very young age, alongside his parents. This loan will enable him to buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizers. In the coming years, he plans to increase his production and to diversify his crops so that he can win customers from other villages.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pape

texts.fr:
Pape est un cultivateur de maraîchage d'onions établi dans le village de mbane, il est marié et père de 6 enfants, son âge s'élève à 30 ans, il a commencé cette activité de culture d'onions depuis son enfance avec ses parents, ce prêt lui permettra d'accroître sa production et gagner d'autres marchés.

Il envisage à l'avenir de travailler d'autres spéculations afin de diversifier ses cultures.
texts.en: Pape is an onion grower who lives in the village of Mbane. He is 30 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He started market gardening alongside his parents when he was very young. This loan will enable him to increase his production and to win more markets. In the coming years, he plans to work on other crops so that he can diversify his produce.

loans.use: to buy onions seeds, herbicide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives with her son and husband in Qarinj village of Lori region. They run a farm. Their farm is successful enough and provides her with stable monthly income for her and her family's living. 
Now, by applying for this loan of USD 2500 Flora would like to purchase agro machine (lawnmower) for organizing cultivation process. 
She will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business and help to develop it further. As this is Flora's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for agro machine (lawnmower) for organizing cultivation process

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba est un jeune homme âgé de 35 ans qui habite dans la commune. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la coiffure et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Il est à son 2ème prêt et a besoin de ce crédit pour terminer sa maison en construction. Il a comme charges particulières les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir il souhaite augmenter ses revenus en ouvrant d’autres salons de coiffure et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. De ce fait il pourra épargner un peu de son argent à coté et diversifier son activité.
texts.en: Samba is a young 35-year-old man who lives in the commune. He is married and a father. He is a hairdresser with over 10 years experience in the business. This is his second loan which he needs so that he can finish building his house. He is responsible for covering the daily expenses and his children's education expenses. He starts his workday at 9am and finishes at 8pm. In the future, he would like to increase his income by opening other hairdressing salons and to improve his family's living conditions. Then he will be able to save a little money and diversify his business.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kids' clothing

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a 45 year old female responsible for taking care of four children .Her business is selling tomatoes, cabbage and  beans in the market stall. She started the business so as to earn income and look after her four children being the only bread winner in her family.Jennifer has got a challenge of her goods getting spoilt thus making losses and her vision is to have a good house and buy a freezer to keep her goods fresh. She needs a loan to buy more tomatoes, cabbage and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, cabbages and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama est un cultivateur d'onions établi dans le village de mbane, il est âgé de 57 ans, marié et père de 15 enfants,il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage d'onions depuis son enfance avec ses parents, ce prêt lui permet d'acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il compte à l'avenir augmenter sa production en qualité et en quantité afin d'accroître sa clientèle et gagner d'autres marchés vers d'autres villages.
texts.en:
Mama, age 57, is an onion farmer who lives in a village called Mbane. He's married and the father of 15 children.

He started this onion farming business during his childhood, with his parents. This loan will enable him to buy onion seeds, herbicide, and fertilizers.

In the future, he intends to increase the quality and quantity of his production, in order to expand his clientele and conquer additional markets in other villages.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, herbicide, and fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is a Ugandan married with four children .She used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.To supplement her husbands earnings,she has used the proceeds from her business she has to start up rentals. Evelyne is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations of her products but is determined to meet her dream of completing the rentals and taking her children to university. She needs another loan to to buy general merchandise such as bread,sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bread,suga and salt to sell.

loans.name: Elizalee

texts.en:
Elizalee is a responsible mother who was gifted with only one child. She engages herself in buying and retailing rice and feed to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve her business in order to generate a higher income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Due to insufficient capital, Elizalee is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of rice and feed to sell in the local community. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of rice and feed to sell

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: Welina is a married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) and a small cafeteria in her place. Welina wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she joined CEVI to gain access to loan services. Welina is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries, snack foods and other items to sell. She is optimistic that this loan will allow her to improve her inventory, which attracts more buyers.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries, snack foods and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Rhoda from Masvingo. She is married with three children, and two are attending school. Rhoda runs a retail business selling electrical goods. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are of credit customers failing to pay on time and high import duties. 

Rhoda has requested a loan of $600 to buy electrical items for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children easily. In the future Rhoda plans to stock a variety of electrical products.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items for resale

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en:
Zacarias is a married man and a father of one adult son. He lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. For many years now, Zacarias has been growing rice to earn a living. This is the source of his income.

Zacarias is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings and pay rental fees for a tractor. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and yield. In the future, Zacarias has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings and pay rental fees for a tractor

loans.name: Ayitcheme 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEME 4 est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, nommée Charlotte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Charlotte est mariée à un photographe du nom de Jamick. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Charlotte vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Charlotte vend du maïs à son domicile depuis huit ans ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. De façon secondaire, Charlotte vend aussi du charbon de bois. Charlotte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroître le niveau de son activité Charlotte ensemble avec les membres du groupement AYITCHEME 4 sollicitent pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Ayitcheme 4 group is made up of 15 people who live in the same district. The group representative, Charlotte (the woman with her hand raised in the picture), is 43 years old. She did not get much schooling. Charlotte is married to a photographer called Jamick. The couple have 3 dependent children who all go to school. Charlotte lives with her husband and children. The couple both take care of the various household expenses. In order to be able to meet her family's needs as well as her own, Charlotte has been selling maize from her home for 8 years. She also sells charcoal. Charlotte gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to be able to increase her level of business, Charlotte is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Ayitcheme 4 group. The previous loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and charcoal.

loans.name: Balikyegomba Kikonge Group

texts.en: Agnes is a Ugandan married and hardworking lady, aged 32 years with 5 children. She lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop, farming and selling produce to earn a living. She hopes to educate her children despite price fluctuations of agriculture products. Agnes is requesting for a loan to buy sodas, sugar, salt, and soap for resale. She is a member of Balikyegomba Kikonge Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, salt, and soap for resale

loans.name: Nestar

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Nestar from Harare. She is divorced with two children, both attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Nestar runs a retail business selling men's and ladies' wear. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenge being faced is lack of working capital to improve stock levels.
