loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 75 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Wycliffe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							
Wycliffe is a reliable member of the community.  He is married, with six children.  Wycliffe is 36 years old, and has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Wycliffe is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages					
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Wycliffe’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and has continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  As an active member in his community, Wycliffe also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Wycliffe plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, and invest in a business.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to save money, and was able to feed the family.					

Wycliffe and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rabbi (2) Group

texts.en:
Roselyne Mireille is a member of the group RABBI (2) and leads a group of eight other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Congo. At 35 years old, Roselyne is married and the mother of two children, ages 8 and 14. Roselyne has been working her own stand in the market, selling a variety of small goods for the past nine years. 

Now on her eighth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Roselyne plans to take out a loan of 300,000 CFAs in local currency, or approximately $600. 

With this next loan, Roselyne will buy packets of bissap leaves to sell to juice vendors and beans for her stand.  

In the future, Roselyne would like to be able to purchase a plot of land for her own store, and also purchase a piece of land for her family to live on.

loans.use: to purchase packets of bissap leaves and beans to sell at her stand

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Ее зовут Иноят. Она из района Спитамен Худжанского городка. Инояту исполняется 44 года. Она учительница средней школы. Она живет сыном, он строитель, работает на стройке. Так как зарплата учительницы не большая Иноят решилась взять кредит и параллельно начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она хочет выращивать скотин. У нее имеется корм и коровник. Она построила коровник с размером 3х5. У Иноят имеется все условия для данной деятельности, но из-за того что много средств она вложила в постройку коровника и купли корма для них и нее не хватает средств для купли скотин. Она просит ей помочь купить телят, чтобы начать бизнес. Поддержите Иноят.
texts.en: This woman's name is Inoyat. She is from the Spitamen District of the Khujand city. Inoyat is 44 years old. She is a secondary school teacher. She lives with her son who is a builder on a construction site. As a teacher's salary is small, Inoyat decided to take out a loan and concurrently start a new business in the field of livestock breeding. She wants to raise cattle. She has livestock feed and a cattle barn. She built the cattle barn in a 3x5 dimension. Inoyat has all of the conditions for her planned business. However, because she invested a lot of her money in the construction of the barn and the purchase of the livestock feed,  she does not have enough money to buy cattle. She is asking that you help her buy a calf so that she can start her business. Please support Inoyat.

loans.use: to buy a calf to start her new business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, John has been working hard to manage his salon, where he shaves men's hair. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spirit, powder and a sterilizing machine, and will help John to generate greater profits and make the business environment friendly and welcoming. John hopes that in the future he will be able to offer quality services. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy spirit, powder and a sterilizing machine.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a married woman and a mother of a  3-year-old son. Her husband worked as a carpenter's helper to support their family. Isidra has been engaged in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Isidra is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, crop medicines, and a sprayer to gain more harvest. 

Through this loan, Isidra is hopeful that she will be able to increase her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Isidra hopes of making her business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crop medicines, and a sprayer to gain more harvest

loans.name: Petita Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
 En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 57 años de edad está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. El marido no tiene trabajo y trabaja ocasionalmente. 
Doña Petita para salir poder adelante con el primer crédito que recibió del banco construyo un pequeño local en su casa en la cual surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí  vende todo tipo de productos además de  sodas, aguas, helados,  entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día ya que como es en su casa no se le hace duro el trabajo, gracias a esto ellos salen adelante y pueden llevar el pan a su mesa.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio, va a comprar sodas, aguas, helados y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en: The Virgen del Rosario financing group meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are renowned nationally and internationally. In this area the majority of residents work in the production of buttons derived from palm trees, handicrafts, and general commerce. Petita lives in this area, and she's a 57 year old woman who's married but has been unable to have children. Her husband doesn't have a job and works occasionally. To get ahead Petita used the first bank loan to build a location at her home and set up a small grocery store. She sells all sorts of things in addition to sodas, water, ice cream, among other things. Since the store's location at her home makes the job feel less difficult, she works every day for almost the entire day. Thanks to this they support themselves and are able to put food on the table. She's going to use this loan to further stock her store, and purchase sodas, water, ice cream, and other essential products. For 8 years she's been in the financing group and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her goal is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase water, sodas, ice cream, and other essential products

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a  woman from the town of Trinidad in the province of Bohol. She is married and has three children who are still attending school. Alicia operates a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells basic household commodities such as rice, sugar, canned goods and toiletries. She also works on her farm growing rice for additional income.

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy rice, sardines and sugar, and also fertilizer for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock as well as the productivity of her farm. In the future, Alicia hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sardines and sugar, and also fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rainforest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Nicholas is married and has two children. He is a driver. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 10 years now and they are currently growing trees and bananas and also rearing poultry. Nicholas is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income.

This is Nicholas's first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy a dairy cow. Nicholas's hope for the future is to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jairo Ronald

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive el señor Jairo, tiene 23 años,  está soltero y estudia Administración de Empresas en una Universidad de Manta, el vive en casa de los padres.
Don Jairo es un joven muy trabajador que para obtener sus recursos y con estos pagarse sus estudios tiene un pequeño negocio, él compro un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con el cual elabora los botones pero en forma cruda,  todos los fines de semana el lleva lo que ha elaborado a la ciudad de Manta para entrega sus productos a comerciantes los mismos que se encargan de exportar estos productos a otros países donde les dan el acabado para luego ser comercializados. De esta forma el se gana lo suficiente para sus estudios y para ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos que genera el hogar.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua para la fabricación de los botones. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser un gran empresario.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every fortnight in Colorado in Montecristi Canton. This place is known nationally and abroad for it's rich per-colonial culture and handicrafts. The majority of it's inhabitants make buttons from Tagua wood, make handicrafts or work in commerce.

Jairo lives here. He is 23 years old, single and is studying Business Administration at a university in Manta. He lives with his parents.

Jairo is a hard-working young man who has a small business in order to make some money and pay for his studies. He bought a lathe (a small machine to cut tagua) which he uses to make unfinished buttons. Every week-end he takes what he has made to the city of Manta to sell his product to merchants who export them to other countries where they are finished and sold. In this way he makes enough money to pay for this studies and help his parents with the household expenses. 

The loan will be used to by tagua to make buttons. He has been in the communal bank for 3 cycles. He likes it as the loans are quick. His dream is to finish his studies and become a great businessman.

loans.use: to buy tagua wood.

loans.name: Phally Group

texts.en: Phally is 53 years old. She is a married woman who has four children and lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. For a living, she sells breads with meat and meatballs. Her husband is a farmer. Phally is the leader of this group. Now, she would like to apply for loan to purchase a latrine. This loan can help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy a motorbike for her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase a latrine.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called Yehowa Da, and the group is made up of three who all live in the same area. They are into the sale of secondhand clothing and slippers, as well as fish and kenkey (maize paste).

The representative of the group, Patricia (who stands on the left in the photo), is 38 years old and has attended school to the secondary level. She is single with a six-year-old child. Patricia takes care of the various family expenses.

To manage this, she has been selling secondhand clothing and slippers from door to door for the past six years. She procures her goods in a market in Accra. This work has allowed her, without great difficulty, to meet the needs of her family.

In order to expand her purchasing capacity, Patricia, together with the other group members, is seeking a third loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly. They will need a total amount of GHS 1,600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy and sell secondhand clothing and slippers from door to door.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a merchant from the town of San Miguel in Bohol. She is married with three children. She is engaged in retail sales of household and kitchenware like plates, bowls and cutlery, as well as clothing and fashion accessories. This is the source of her income. 

Ma. Chona is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like shirts, pants, undergarments, plates, cutlery and so on. It could attract more customers.
 
In the future, Ma. Chona hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability so that she will be able to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like shirts, pants, undergarments, plates, cutlery and other items.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. She has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothing. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and increase capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger clothing shop. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more clothes.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his welding workshop, which sells door frames and windows. 

To help expand his business, Remegio has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metals, and will help him to generate greater profits and increase the family income. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have more stock to sell. 

Remegio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Remegio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more metals.

loans.name: Mukhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё решительная и целеустремленная женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Она из района Спитамен, который расположен в северной части страны. Мухайё живет с мужем и дочерью. В настоящий момент ее муж находится на заработках в России. Мухайё работает в текстильной фабрике и получает маленькую зарплату. Она хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи и поэтому решила вместе с дочерью заняться торговым бизнесом. Мухайё планирует продавать фрукты на местном рынке и считает это прибыльным бизнесом. Однако для купли товара Мухайё не хватает собственного начального капитала, в связи с чем она обратилась за кредитом. Этот кредит важен для Мухайё и она с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Mukhayo is a strong-willed and goal-oriented 43-year-old woman. She is from the Spitamen District, which is located in the northern portion of the country. Mukhayo lives with her husband and daughter. Currently, her husband is working abroad in Russia. Muhayo works in a textile factory and earns a small salary. She wants to improve the financial situation of her family, which is why she and her daughter took up retail sales. Mukhayo plans to sell fruit at the local market and considers it a profitable business. However, Mukhayo does not have enough personal start-up capital to buy these goods, which is why she requested a loan. This loan is important to Mukhayo. She awaits your support with hope.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fruits for retail sale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and the mother of two children. Antonia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more fish to the market. Antonia hopes of improving her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Regina is a widow with four children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 35 years now and she is currently growing bananas in her farm. Regina is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Regina’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Regina’s hope for the future is to improve her farm.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jorge Ilario

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive don Jorge, tiene 64 años de edad,  está casado y de esta relación  tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad e independientes,  su esposa es una muy buena ama de casa.
El señor Jorge para ganarse la vida y para que a su familia no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, el compra y vende tagua para lo cual casi todos los días viaja hasta las afueras de la ciudad en un pequeño camión que tiene y compra la tagua en un depósito del lugar que  le dejan a muy buen precio, luego de esto él entrega a sus clientes de su localidad que en su mayoría se dedican a trabajar la tagua, el les vende a un precio razonable que le permita ganar algo para el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar tagua. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten comprar al contado y a mejor precio. Sus sueños son comprar un carro nuevo
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen Del Rosario meets every two weeks in Colorado, in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts of national and international renown. Most residents here work making crafts, particularly buttons made with tagua nuts, or in retail in general. 

This is where Jorge lives. He is 64 years old and married. He has five adult children from this relationship, who live on their own. His wife is an excellent homemaker. In order to make a living and for his family to have everything they need, Jorge works as a merchant. He buys and sells tagua nuts by traveling almost daily to the outskirts of town in his small truck and purchasing from a local warehouse that offers very good prices. He then delivers it to his customers in town, who mostly work making things with tagua nuts. He sells to them at a reasonable price that allows him to make some profit for his family's wellbeing. This loan is to buy tagua nuts.

He has been a member of his communal bank for two cycles and enjoys it because the loans allow him to pay for purchases upfront and at a better price. One of his dreams is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy tagua nuts.

loans.name: Ubilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ubilda, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen  cinco hijas mayores de edad, una de ellas aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es abogado.
Doña Ubilda es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta a base de trabajo y esfuerzo salir adelante, ella tiene una papelería en su casa en la cual sus clientes encuentran de todo desde libros hasta cualquier tipo de útiles escolares, su local  es muy concurrido ya que esta justo al frente de una universidad que hay en la ciudad,  trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas y en tiempo de entrada a clases le ayudan más de tres en su negocio ya que ella no se puede hacer cargo de tanta gente que llega a comprar sus listas de útiles escolares, lleva más de 9 años con su negocio con el cual está muy contenta ya que se gana la vida en algo que le gusta 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar todo tipo de útiles escolares para surtir su negocio. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Oro de Montecristi" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known both nationally and internationally. It is from here that the famous Panamá hat comes.

Ubilda lives here. She is 52 years old is married and from this relationship has five children, who now are all adults. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is a lawyer.

Ubilda is an enterprising woman who likes work and effort to get ahead. She has a stationary store where her customers can find everything from a book to any type of school supply. Her store is very busy as it is located right in front of a university. She works every day with the help of her children. And when classes go back in at least 3 of them help as she cannot take care of so many people who come with their list of school supplies. She has been in this business for more than 9 years and she is quite happy as it earns a living and is something she enjoys doing.

The loan will be used to buy all kinds of school supplies to stock her store. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 cycles and likes it as the loans are quick and without a lot of conditions. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. Agnes operates a retail shop, selling household items such as detergent, toilet paper, and vaseline. 

To help expand her business, Agnes requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to add stock of detergent, toilet paper, vaseline, and other items. The loan will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to fill up her shop. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase detergent,toilet paper, vaseline, and other items

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which raises poultry birds. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken feeds and chickens, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and increase family income. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy more layers and broilers. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy chicken feeds and chickens.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Jeremiah is married and has four children. He is a village elder and a retired assistant chief (a position in municipal government). Both he and his wife practice farming where they grow sugarcane, maize, bananas and vegetables. Jeremiah is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income as well as provide him with honey for food.

This is Jeremiah's first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family's upkeep. Jeremiah's hope for the future is to live a peaceful life with his wife in their old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anorkhol

texts.ru: Анорхолу из района Хуросон 56 лет. Она замужем. У них двое сыновей. Один из сыновей из-за отсутствия работы уехал в Российскую Федерацию. Другой сын работает продавцом в магазине. Анорхол на данный момент не работает. Ранее она занималась животноводством, после паузы она вновь решила возобновить деятельность. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Анорхол на заемные деньги намерена купить только телят. У нее уже имеется корм и остался коровник. Сейчас в Таджикистане весна и уже на улице тепло. Этот сезон прекрасно подходит для развития данного бизнеса. Анорхол надеется на вашу отзывчивость. Поддержите Анорхол.
texts.en: Anorkhol is 56 years old and is from the Khuroson District. She is married and has two sons. Due to the lack of jobs, one of her sons left to work in the Russian Federation. Her other son works as a salesperson in a store. Anorkhol currently does not work. In the past, she practiced livestock breeding and after a break from it, she decided to restart this business. For this reason she requested a loan. With the borrowed money, Anorkhol is determined to buy only calves. She already has livestock feed and her cow barn remains from before. It's now spring in Tajikistan and it's already warm outside. This season is a good match for the development of this business. Anorkhol relies on your generosity. Please support Anorkhol.

loans.use: to buy calves to resume her business.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de charbon, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NIAGALE, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang  des assises, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs d’oignon, 2 paniers de tomate, et du sel chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group KOTOGNONTALA is composed of married women, who average 51 years of age and two children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Zanfina, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, charcoal, and clothing.

The women of the group KOTOGNONTALA are on their tenth solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, NIAGALE, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo, is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase 2 sacks of onions, 2 baskets of tomatoes, and some salt from wholesalers in Konobougou. The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, tomatoes, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chuajuyub Group

texts.es:
Diego (primero de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es un hombre soltero, 58 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá. 
Diego comenta que la actividad que realiza es la siembra de maxan (hoja natural utilizada para envoltorio y conserva de alimentos) ya que es un producto rentable. Esta labor la aprendió de sus padres; además es algo que le gusta hacer y con ello obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a colaborar con la economía de su familia.
El ha venido realizando esta actividad desde niño, por lo que ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que un día tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de maxan.
Su sueño comprar un terreno para poder incrementar su negocio y así ofrecerles mayores volúmenes de su producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Diego, the first person from the left in the picture, is 58 years old. He is single and lives with his four children in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, in Sololá. Diego says his business is growing 'maxan' (the plant calathea lutea). Its leaves are used to wrap and preserve food, so this plant is a profitable product. He learned this work from his parents and it is also something that he enjoys doing and that allows him to make a good income. The profits help him contribute to his household's economy. 

He has been in this business ever since he was a child, so by now he is very knowledgeable about it. That is why one day he decided to form a group in order to diversify his products on the market and obtain higher incomes for all the members of the group and their families. They will use the loan to buy supplies to maintain their plants. His dream is to buy a plot of land to expand his business so that he can offer his customers a higher volume of product.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his plants.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра жительница района Спитамен. Ей 36 лет. Она работает в местной школе учительницей. Ее муж травматолог, он работает в центральной районной больнице. Семья Гулчехры арендует 1 га земельный участок, где каждый год они выращивают кукурузу для продажи. В этом году Гулчехра решила заняться еще и животноводством, так как у них есть все условия для ведения данного бизнеса. Гулчехра планирует купить двух голов крупнорогатого скота и для этой цели просит кредит. Она надеется, что начав новый бизнес, сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Этот кредит важен Гулчехре и ее семье.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a resident of the Spitamen District. She is 36 years old. She works in a local school as a teacher. Her husband is trauma surgeon who works in the district's central hospital. Gulchehra's family rents a one hectare plot of land on which they grow corn for sale every year. This year, Gulchehra decided to additionally take up livestock breeding, as they have all of the conditions necessary for running this business. Gulchehra plans to buy two cows which is why she is requesting a loan. She hopes that, by starting this new business, she will be able to improve her family's financial situation. This loan is very important to Gulchehra and her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows to start her new business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dounamakebougou, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de charbon, de savon, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente MASSITAN, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon artisanal. Elle compte acheter 160 morceaux de savon artisanal chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 42 years of age and four children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Dounamakebougou, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, condiments, charcoal, soap, and general merchandise.

The women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their seventh solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, MASSITAN, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of artisanal soaps. She intends to purchase 160 pieces of artisanal soaps from wholesalers at the weekly market. The sales are made at her house or by hawking to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. She plans on making a monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA that will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal soap

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is widowed and has 3 children who are all currently in school. Charles has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soft drinks, beers, water, juice, soap, posho, rice, salt and other items. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks, beers, water, juice, soap, posho, rice, salt and other items, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, water, juice, soap, posho, rice and salt.

loans.name: Krobor Bukom Group

texts.en:
Krobor Bukom is a group who live in Accra-Teshie, located in coastal Ghana. The group was formed to take loans to enable them to stay in active business. They are into fish, plastic bowls, firewood, ceramic plates and clothing and have been successfully running this small business. They have taken five different loans and are now on their sixth loan cycle.

The featured borrower is Rebecca A. who is 42 years old and into the sale of smoked fish. She has been doing this business for 20 years. Her previous loan repayments have been successful. She is married with two dependable children. She is requesting this loan to buy two cartons of fish from the cold store to smoke and supply to her customers.

The group would need a total amount of GHS 3,950 to buy enough goods and serve customers better.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish from the cold store to smoke and supply to her customers.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de soumbala, de charbon, et de savon. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente KADIA,  personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de soumbala. Elle compte acheter 60 kg de grains de néré, et 1 chargement de bois sur place avec les paysans du village. Après 5 jours de traitement, le produit final sera mis au marché. La vente se fait en détail, et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Zanfina, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in 'soumbala', charcoal, and soap.

The women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their second solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, KADIA, who is standing in the middle of her row in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of soumbala [pounded and fermented seeds used in cooking]. She intends to purchase 60 kg of néré seeds and a load of firewood locally from peasant farmers in the village. After five days of processing, the final product will be put up for sale. The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her house. She plans on making a monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients fo making 'sounbala' [a kind of condiment used in cooking traditional meals]

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MOUGNOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de charbon, et de drap et rideau. Les femmes du groupe MOUGNOU sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJOUMA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de draps et rideaux. Elle compte acheter 1 rouleau de popeline, et 20 rouleaux de fils chez les grossistes à Fana, puis les transformes en drap et rideau de qualité. La vente se fait en espèce et a crédit chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
MOUGNOU is a group of married women who average 42 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional families in Zanfina, a village in the commune of Guégnéka, prefecture of Dioïla (Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They run restaurant activities and sell cereals, condiments, charcoal, bed sheets and curtains.  

To meet their massive customer demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 2nd group loan cycle. The funds will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. 

DJOUMA is the group member standing first from the left in the photo. She is illiterate. Djouma is currently a reseller of bed sheets and curtains. She plans to use her loan to buy one bolt of poplin and 20 spools of thread from wholesalers in Fana to make high-quality curtains and bed sheets. She retails her merchandise from her home to a diverse clientele, for cash or on credit.   

Djouma expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover her family’s daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy poplin and thread to make curtains and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALY est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de charbon de bois, et de lait. Les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO..
La cliente MINATA,  première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de lait. Elle compte acheter 100 litres sur place avec les peulhs du village. La vente se fait en gros chez elle uniquement à ses clients venus de konobougou. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 23 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Sabaly Group is made up of married women who average 51 years of age and 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Zanfina, a village in the municipality of Guégnéka, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, charcoal, and milk. In order to meet a huge customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Minata is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's illiterate and, at this time, a milk seller. She intends to buy 100 liters of milk from the Fulani in the village.

She sells wholesale at her home, only to her customers coming from Konobougou. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 23'000, to be used to cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 100 liters of milk

loans.name: Renal

texts.en:
Renal lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit. Renal is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Renal joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Renal sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $29 - $30 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Doña Rosario es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, soltera y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 54 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con la venta de bananos y tortillas, luego fue incrementando sus ganancias y logro comprar granos básicos y poco a poco fue incrementando su pulpería con más productos. Su meta próxima es aumentar su inventario para ofrecerles una mayor variedad a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Azúcar, Maíz, Frijoles entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Doña Rosario, age 54, is originally from the city of Estelí. She is a single mother of three children who are already independent. Rosario is a merchant by trade. She has a grocery business that she started by selling bananas and tortillas. After she increased her earnings, she was able to buy basic grains and gradually increased the inventory of her store with more products.

Her next goal is to offer more products so that she can provide a wider variety to her customers. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, and other products. She believes this loan will be very helpful because she will be able to meet the demand of her customers. Her plan for the future is to offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Marina Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Marina, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene tres hijos 9, 7 y 3 años, las mayores están en escuela y la menor en jardín de infantes.
Doña Mariana es una mujer que hace todo lo posible para darles lo mejor a sus hijos,  ella se dedica a vender ropa por catálogos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  y a cada lugar que va lleva su revista la misma que muestra a sus clientes para que escojan lo que deseen, luego ella hace los pedidos entrega y cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le permite sacar adelante ella sola a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa  y productos Yanbal. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos  le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Primero De Abril meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts of national and international renown. It is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

This is where Marina lives. She is 31 years old. She is separated, but has three children from that relationship. They are ages nine, seven, and three. The two older ones are in school and the youngest is in kindergarten. Marina does everything she can to give her children the best. She works selling clothing by catalog and Yanbal products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's accessories). She makes her sales door to door and brings her magazine to each place and shows it to her customers for them to choose what they want. She then makes the orders, the deliveries, and collects payments once a week, since she fills the orders on credit. She has been in this business for over five years, and it allows her to provide for her children on her own. 

This loan is to buy clothing and Yanbal products. She has been in her communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because the loans allow her to get ahead. One of her dreams is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives in Kakamega which is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old-growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide the bees with a variety of forage.

Jacob is married and has six children. He is a pastor while his wife is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty six years now and she is currently growing horticultural crops and rearing dairy cattle and bees on their farm. Jacob is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income.

This is Jacob’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay the school fees for his children. Jacob’s hope for the future is to see his children become independent.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un señor muy trabajador, que por medio de su sacrificio ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Es electricista, y cuenta que su primer préstamo de Kiva lo uso para poder comprar gas, cables y otros insumos para poder hacer su trabajo.
Comenta que su esposa para poder ayudar en la casa esta empezando a trabajar en alquileres de cubiertos para acontecimientos, y es para ello que Javier pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de de cubiertos y sillas, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a su esposa con esta emprendimiento que quiere hacer.
texts.en:
Javier is a very hard worker. His sacrifice allows him to help his family and to give them everything they need in order to have a decent life. He is an electrician, and he says he used his first Kiva loan to buy gas, cables, and other supplies he needed to do his job.

He says his wife has started working in order to help out at home. She rents silverware for planned events and that is why Javier is requesting this loan, so that he can invest in purchasing silverware and chairs in order to help his wife with her new business venture.

loans.use: to buy silverware and chairs.

loans.name: Christ Roi (1) Group

texts.en:
Gildas is a member of the group Christ Roi (1) and the leader of a group consisting of four other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Gildas is on his third loan cycle with Hope. He and his wife have a one-year-old child and they dream of being able to build their own family home. 

Gildas has a small shop selling food and various other goods, and want to use his next loan to purchase additional products to resell, such as soap, beauty products, and candy. In the future, Gildas hopes to open a store that sells bulk products.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell, such as soap, beauty products, and candy.

loans.name: Xolcaja Group

texts.es:
Diego (primero de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía) es un hombre soltero, 45 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos, en Nahualá, Sololá. 
Diego dice que la actividad que realiza es la siembra de maxan (hoja natural utilizada para envoltorio y conserva de alimentos) ya que es un producto rentable. Esta labor la aprendió de sus padres; además es algo que le gusta hacer y con ello obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a colaborar con la economía de su familia.
El ha venido realizando esta actividad desde niño, por lo que ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que un día tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de maxan.
Su sueño es incrementar la siembra de maxan y así ofrecerles mayores volúmenes de su producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Diego, the first person from the right in the picture, is 45 years old. He is single and lives with his three children in Nahualá, Sololá. Diego says his business is growing 'maxan' (the plant calathea lutea). Its leaves are used to wrap and preserve food, so this plant is a profitable product. He learned this work from his parents and it is also something that he enjoys doing and that allows him to make a good income. The profits help him contribute to his household's economy. 

He has been in this business ever since he was a child, so by now he is very knowledgeable about it. That is why one day he decided to form a group in order to diversify his products on the market and obtain higher incomes for all the members of the group and their families. They will use the loan to buy supplies to maintain their plants. His dream is to expand his crops so that he can offer his customers a higher volume of product.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his plants.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of Western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Joseph is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, horticultural crops and rearing livestock on their farm. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to develop his livelihood. Joseph's hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mercy Marina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercy, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años que estudia en colegio. Ella vive con su hijo y una hermana que también es soltera.
Doña Mercy es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar honradamente para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), además en su casa también se dedica a la venta de carbón, material que es muy utilizado en los negocios de comida, su formas de venta es puerta a  puerta y trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o realizando sus recorridos, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de 4 años en este negocio el cual le permite sacar  adelante  sola a su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y varios productos más. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en: The Primero De Abril financing group meets every two weeks in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are nationally and internationally renowned. It's the birthplace of the famous Panama straw hat. This is where Mercy lives, she's a 49 year old single mother of a 16 year old high school student. She lives with her son and a sister of hers who is also single. Mercy is a very hard-working woman who likes to put in an honest day's work to support her son. In her job she sells clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), and in addition she sells charcoal, a widely used product in food businesses. She does her selling door-to-door and works every day, either at home or on her routes. She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend. For over four years she's been at this job that has allowed her to support her son by herself. This loan is to purchase clothes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and several other products. She's been in the financing group for 3 years and likes it because of the help she's received through the loans. Her dream is to give her son the best education.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Christ Roi (2) Group

texts.en:
Brice is married and the father of two children. He also cares for one additional family member. 

Brice is a member and leader of the loan group Christ Roi (2), a group of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Brice is on his third loan cycle with HOPE Congo. When Brice first became involved with HOPE, he sold packaging materials for a living. Now, he has a small business renting out wheelbarrows. 

Brice will use this loan of 700,000 XAF to purchase more packaging supplies to sell and additional wheelbarrows to rent out. In the future, Brice hopes to sell his wheelbarrows and open several small shops. His dreams for his family are to finish his home and expand his business to include his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase additional wheelbarrows to rent out and packaging supplies to sell

loans.name: Walter Miguel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Walther, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos  de 19, 18 y 16 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
Don Walther para ganarse la vida y con estas ganancias poder cumplir con sus obligaciones en el hogar se dedica a la venta de  frutas y legumbres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 14h00, el se desplaza en su carro en la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo para comprar los productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo mejor, luego recorre la ciudad y ciertos campos cercanos vendiendo sus productos, tiene 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual siempre les ha dado lo mejor a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products that are well-known both nationally and internationally. It is also from here that the famous Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 34 year old Walter lives. He is married and has three children, ages 19, 18, and 16 years old. The children go to school. Walter's wife is a housewife.

Walter makes a living selling fruits and vegetables.  With these earnings he is able to fulfill his household obligations.  He works every day from 5 a.m. until 2 p.m.  He goes out with his car early in the morning to the wholesale market in Portoviejo. There he buys the best products to offer to his customers.  He then travels through the city and nearby places to sell his products.  Walter has been doing this work for 18 years, and with this work he has always given his family the best.

Walter will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. He has been with the communal bank for three years, and he likes it because the loans have been a great help to him to finance his business. Walter's dream is to buy another car as the one he has now is a little deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of Western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya”. Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Samuel is married and has four children, and he runs a business in electrical installation. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for thirteen years now and they are currently growing maize and rearing livestock on their farm. Samuel is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Samuel's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his electrical business. Samuel's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. 

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Teresiah is single with two children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty two years now and currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, and rearing livestock in her farm. Teresiah is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Teresiah’s first loan with Honey Care, and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her other projects. Teresiah’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dieu Aide Nous (1) Group

texts.en: Bernadette is a member of the group DIEU AIDE NOUS (1) and is the leader of a group consisting of eight other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. A single mother of three children, Bernadette sells foufou, a local dish, and hot food that she grills on the spot. Now on her third loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Bernadette plans on using her loan to buy more bags of foufou and chicken thighs to prepare and sell. In the future she hopes to start her own butcher’s shop and an embroidery business as well. Bernadette dreams of being able to save up enough money to take her family on a vacation and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase foufou and chicken thighs to prepare and sell at her stand
